Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Allison555
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. In a time where everyone is trying to get more and more money out of you it was nice to stay as a hotel that still treats you well. Complementary bottled water doesn't sounds like a big deal but other hotels we stayed at during our trip had water in the room for a cost of 9 dollars for one bottle. The hotel also provides free wifi and breakfast. The breakfast was very good and we left full and ready for our days of sight seeing. The hotel front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again if we return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Adventures0fAandL
Reviews.Content: I was so glad to have chosen the Auberge Bonaparte. We stayed 4 nights in the room with the wonderful balcony and found the accommodations, service and location all great. The hotel was very willing to store our bicycles (highly recommend bringing these with you if you can) in the basement and bring them up each morning on the elevator. The breakfast was truly outstanding and I also enjoyed the very creative floral arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: BluesTravelerVirgina
Reviews.Content: Rooms are otstanding as are the service staff. Convenience and quality restaurant cannot be beat. Great location. Montreal is COLD in the winter. Dress and plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “We felt so special and taken care of”
Reviews.Author: seniortravelers_12
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spend 4 days in Old Montreal and by chance and at short notice booked Auberge Bonaparte. Ideal location, superb service, attention to detail, lovely, clean and spacious room, and helpful staff. And then there is the restaurant....Breakfast is not to be missed, and dinner on a rainy night was a complete surprise. I went with a girlfriend to celebrate her birthday, but next time I am taking my husband. Auberge Bonaparte is great for friends and for a romantic couples get-away!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better customer service”
Reviews.Author: CarlaSandiego12866
Reviews.Content: The room was cozy with high ceilings, window seats, and a jacuzzi-style bathtub.In addition to the nice room there was a rooftop balcony and a mouth-watering restaurant. It wasn't hard to get out of bed in the morning because we knew that a delicious breakfast awaited us downstairs. Everything we ordered came out deliciously fresh and perfectly portioned. We especially enjoyed the morning that we were seated by the window because we were able to people watch out onto the historic streets of Vieux Montreal. The best part of the hotel was the staff. Michael and Sabrina were more help than all Montreal guidebooks put together. They suggested the best attractions, told us where to get a real local meal, and even made our dinner reservations for us. Without them we never would have made it to the Notre Dame light show (very cool) or the wonderful cheese shop close to the Jean-Talon market (La Fromagerie Hamel). By the time we left it felt like we were leaving friends. Thanks for making our trip so special!

Reviews.Title: “The foodiest hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: Zarkoff
Reviews.Content: My friend and I love to eat at the restaurant Bonaparte but decided to stay there and also enjoy the complementary 3 course breakfast. My friend got to Montreal late so it was great to be there to meet and just pop upstairs after dinner and drinks-delicious and no stress. The room was lovely, wood floors and very nice bath. The bed is very comfy-the only needed upgrade is a replacement to the blankets they have. Down duvets would be all that is needed to make it totally comfortable. This is a lovely place to stay and the food is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Beauxarbres
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is within walking distance of everything in old Montreal. The service from the staff was excellent and the room was spectacular. In a renovated old building the room was spacious and well appointed. Dinner in the restaurant was top quality. When a restaurant is full of well dressed patrons early in the evening there is an expectation that you're in the right place and we were not disappointed. As for location, the auberge is next door to a cooking school, other high quality restaurants and the Centaur Theatre in Montreal. Just two short blocks away from the tourist district of Old Montreal there is ample opportunity to stretch your legs to visit art galleries, craft stores, historic buildings. If you want to take a romantic carriage ride, there are plenty to choose from. The Bains Scandinave spa is also within a few blocks of the hotel - a must do for a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: RossRankin
Reviews.Content: A weekend away at a place that we had eaten at twice. The location and styled rooms was what brought us here. The desk staff are great. They suggested a few restaurants and made our reservations. There was one restaurant that is very popular that we asked a week before arriving if they could make a reservation. Not thinking there was a chance. The last night just after I had made other arrangements they called our room and said they had reserved at the restaurant. We had perfect seats and a great dinner. Besides that the location is great and the rooms are very comfortable with large windows overlooking the narrow streets and great architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for long weekend in Old Town Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Mjanzalone
Reviews.Content: Pretty rooms, very clean, extremely helpful staff, and very convenient location to Old Town Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - A Bit Overrated”
Reviews.Author: KristyneA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here three nights, 16-19 February 2012, in the suite (Room 507). The hotel was very nice but, in my opinion, not as nice as some of the reviews here on TripAdvisor. The suite was clean, comfortable, and tastefully decorated. There were a few things I wasn't particularly happy with. I'd rate the hotel at about 3 3/4 stars if that were possible. Our suite consisted of a large bedroom (the one pictured on the opening TripAdvisor page, at least as of the day I'm writing this), a large bathroom, a decent-sized sitting room, and a hall/foyer connecting the three. Overall, the suite was initially clean and well-constructed, but the furniture was eclectic, in that while nearly every item of furniture was attractive and in the Empire style, few of the pieces looked as though they belonged together. It was as though someone bought various pieces of nice furniture at different yard and estate sales and brought them together - they didn't quite match one another. Dimmer switches in bed, bath, and sitting rooms were a nice touch, as was the fact that all door hinges were well-oiled and didn't squeak. In the bedroom, the matress was very comfortably -- unusually, for both me and my wife. She prefers a relative soft mattress, and I prefer a firm one. This one was firm, but with a very soft top layer, and the sheets were up to my wife's demanding standards ("smooth and confortable, but still substantial). The curtains worked well, so the bedroom was very dark and easy to sleep well in. Other furniture in the bedroom included desk/chair set, side table (with alarm clock) and another table, comfortable chair, bench at the foot of the bed, television vanity with two drawers for clothes, and a roomy closet. Great bedroom. Bathroom was tiled in marble with a granite sink. Amenities included a large "double" jacuzzi (not quite big enough for two), separate comfortably-sized shower stall, mirror, plentiful lights, toilet, plentiful towels, and well-selected toiletries. The only thing noticeably missing was a soap dish for the sink - I disliked having to pry the soap bar from the surface every day. Still, a very nice bath. Sitting room was large enough for two (maybe three or four) to sit comfortably, and the bedroom door permitted one of us to sit up while the other slept. Furniture included a couch, upholstered chair, large coffee table, and several sitting chairs. In the sitting room was a small (larger than dorm size, maybe "half-size") refrigerator that was stocked with a few cans of soda and several bottles of beer. Glasses, mugs, a coffee maker, and coffee were provided (as was a wine bottle opener and sugar tongs), but no tea, sweetener, or creamer/whitener. I thought this might be an oversight the first night, but they weren't provided any of the three nights. Actually, we had to ask a few times to have the refrigerator re-stocked, which annoyed me a bit (the sort of nickel-and-dimey thing that ought not to be an issue, in my opinion). Housekeeping was a bit of an issue. Large messes (e.g., wet towels thrown in the tub) were consistently cleaned and the bed was made well each day, but most "small messes" were missed. Needlepoint scraps left on the coffee table each night were removed, but left on the floor instead, as were crumbs. The refrigerator wasn't restocked until we asked several times, and sweetener for the coffee provided never arrived (admittedly, I forgot to ask specifically for it, but should I need to?) Also, a few light bulbs remained burned out the whole time we were there. A very nice feature was the balcony attached to the sitting room. During our stay, it was covered with snow, but seemed nice - had a nice view of the side of the Basilica of Notre Dame (bells were not an issue, as I had feared - not that loud). There was a cast iron table and pair of chairs which seemed as though they'd be nice on a pleasant evening. Also nice were the sheer curtains behind the main curtains on two of the windows facing the balcony. (I wish they had had sheer curtains behind the main curtains in the bedroom, too, so we could have had the curtains open while dressing). The staff at the hotel was very helpful and pleasant (all spoke English, too). I appreciated the Internet/printer station in the sitting room beside the lobby. Restaurant Bonaparte is located in the same building, and breakfast is served (not by the restaurant staff) there each morning. Breakfast (included with our stay) was very pleasant - juice, coffee, yogurt of fresh fruit salad, croissants or toast, and a choice of several entrees (french toast was very good, as were the omelettes; crepes were good, but lacked filling). At dinner, the restaurant (now with the restaurant staff) is extremely good. We didn't eat lunch there, but I think it's open for lunch. The hotel location was convenient for touring the old city in Montreal, and was about 3-4 blocks from the nearest Metro (subway) station. For some reason, none of the several cab drivers we used in Montreal seemed to be able to find the hotel, even when we provided the address (easiest way is to tell them either to drop you off at the basilica and walk the last block or tell them to drive 3/4 block around from the front of the basilica). Even with the basilica (and its bells), the neighborhood seemed pretty quiet on Thursday-Sunday. Overall, the hotel was very nice, and I'd stay there again (especially in any of rooms 503, 505, and 507). I don't really think it's quite as nice as some other reviewers make it out to be, though. If the owners read this, I'd recommend paying a bit more attention to stocking the refrigerator and coffee/tea supplies and keeping up the housekeeping for occupied rooms. While checking out, I managed to look in adjacent rooms 505 and 503

Reviews.Title: “Simply pefect!”
Reviews.Author: tatina9
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in part because of its Trip Advisor Rating/Reviews which have never disappointed me. I don't opt for #1 ratings exclusively as price does matter since I very much love to travel to new destinations as often as feasible. In this case, it was very evident that this rating was well-deserved. Michael, Sabrina and Sophia were charming and thoughtful. Sabrina remembered that I had asked for a particular room at the time of reservation but was not available. So it was a delight that it was assigned to us upon arrival and I hadn't even mentioned it! The restaraunt here just happened to be outstanding. Everything we had for dinner the first night and breakfasts were delicious! I can't emphasize enough how this hotel made this the best experience of all my Canadian sojourns! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “tres magnifique”
Reviews.Author: 4n6melrn
Reviews.Content: This hotel merges a classic old french beauty with a staff that is above and beyond! Montreal is a very special place because of the wonderful stay. I had stayed at another hotel on business in October and had to return to this city. I saw that trip advisor ranked this hotel #1 and made my decision based on the reviews. The room was warm and welcoming. The staff especially Michael at reception was so personable and accommodating,it truly made this experience special. Lets not forget the food! The french toast was over the top, the french cuisine was a cultural experience and the restaurant staff mimics the hotel reception personel. If you are ever in Montreal treat yourself! A block away from Notre Dome, and three blocks from the metro. A true diamond in the crown!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Schrems
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip to Auberge Bonaparte. Each time I go there, I enjoy it more. The staff is so nice and helpful. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Traveler615
Reviews.Content: Courteous, kind, thoughtful, considerate, cool, comfortable, and friendly. Room, food, location, service and staff were exceptional. Highly recommend. Looking forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “NYE trip”
Reviews.Author: ktdblu1181
Reviews.Content: First time to Montreal and we had an absolutely excellent stay! Not one complaint! Our room was fantastic with a private balcony perfect for viewing the fireworks. Plus the breakfast was terrific as well. Will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carol M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas. It's in a great location for seeing the Basilica and Metro is a short walk away. The staff were very helpful and I really liked the hot tea they provided in the afternoons after we returned from sightseeing. There's a large Breakfast served each morning in the restaurant. Try to get a window seat if possible. We dined at the restaurant one evening - the food was expensive but worth it. Warning - if you plan to use the metro, be aware that they only take canadian dollars and credit cards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place in old town”
Reviews.Author: 60sAussiecouple
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable in a wonderful location. We had a first rate degustation dinner in a packed dining room but with excellent and friendly service. Breakfasts also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Old Montreal experience”
Reviews.Author: Nofoodie
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here. Lovely hotel with a retro feel. Comfortable bed, spacious room, attentive staff. Walking distance to everything important in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “nice receptionist and concierge”
Reviews.Author: alex n
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simple but well located. Free coffee and tea anytime. Very nice people at the reception always willing to help

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor right- it is a Gem”
Reviews.Author: charlie g
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights november 2011. It is a charming small hotel with great staff, breakfast and location. Rooms are smallish but clean and acceptable. We spent $ on taxis going to top rated restaurants elsewhere in town. In retrospect there are fine little restaurants near the hotel that we tried for lunch and which we are sure are very good for dinner as well. The hotel's restaurant is very nice too. Would recommend the hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved being in the old town”
Reviews.Author: amstravel
Reviews.Content: We much preferred staying in the old town of Montreal because the walking was fun, the architecture more interesting and there were fun shops and restaurants from which to chose. The hotel is pleasant and the breakfast is very nice. While the rooms were big, the furniture was not overly comfortable or cozy. Our room looked out back over a grassy lot and the view was nothing special from our room.

Reviews.Title: “You'd think we were the owner's BFFS.”
Reviews.Author: MallomarNY
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at Auberge Bonaparte was perfect, starting with the greeting we got from Anita--the owner's ancient Maltese. She took the edge off a too-long train ride, as did incredibly friendly front desk receptionists Dierdre and Anne Sophie and General Manager Michael Banks. Our room was double-A quality (Adorable and Affordable), facing a beautiful street but quiet. The bed was so comfortable, and the place is spotless and beautifully decorated in fine, cozy French style. Breakfast at the hotel was delicious, substantial--omelets, croissants, mini-muffins, juice, coffee--and included in the reasonable price! The hotel's location is perfect, right in the heart of Old Montreal, with plenty of shopping, restaurants, and sights nearby. It's also only two blocks from the metro. Just try going somewhere without knowing what you're doing; Michael and the super-helpful staff gave us maps, metro plans, and detailed instructions to insure that we'd take the most beautiful routes and get into various exhibits without a hitch. When dinnertime came, all we had to do was ask for recommendations, and those--along with reservations--were made instantly. Every restaurant they steered us to was great. This is the kind of hotel you'd want to keep a secret, but I'm hopeful our new best friends at Auberge Bonaparte will find space for us when we come back in the spring!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Without the Attitude!”
Reviews.Author: EddieW8
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 2 friends (a married couple) in mid-October from NYC to Montreal. We took Amtrak up to see the fall foliage along the way, and it was spectacular. After a long day of train travel, we finally arrived at Auberge Bonaparte Hotel. It is a quaint and charming hotel in the old town of Montreal. Every employee we encountered at this hotel did their best to ensure we had a nice stay. We stayed in a room with one queen bed and one double, and it was perfect for the three of us. The beds were very comfortable and the room was beautifully and tastefully decorated and immaculately clean. The bathroom included a large jacuzzi bath and a separate large shower. To me the room looked even nicer than the pics on their web site. The restaurant in the hotel is also very good. It's a quaint and quiet, white table clothed restaurant. We were only there for two nights but we had dinner the first night and breakfast both mornings. We had the 3-course prix-fixe dinner, and I don't remember the exact price but it was around $25-30 Canadian and was a good value and was delicious. The presentation of the food was very European French and looked like art to me. Breakfast is included for hotel guests and is well worth it. The service in the restaurant was quick, friendly and informative without being intrusive. They seemed to sense what you needed before you even asked. The employees working the reception desk were very professional and helpful. They don't have a separate concierge desk, and it's really not needed because the reception desk personnel go out of their way to answer any questions about Montreal, point you in the right direction, recommend restaurants and bars, make reservations for you, etc. A gentleman who worked in the evening (Michael Banks) was especially helpful in giving us advice for a night on the town in the gay village. Every recommendation that he, as well as all the other reception desk personnel made, was spot on. One particular thing that will probably always stay on my mind when thinking about Bonaparte is the 1st morning we were there it was raining. I didn't have an umbrella and before I even opened the door to go outside the person at the reception desk asked me did I need an umbrella. They apparently had a stock of them for people like me who never seem to remember an umbrella when it's needed! It's the little things like this that really make a place feel special. Bottom line is I really have nothing negative to say about Bonaparte. We had a very pleasurable stay there. I will definitely stay there again when I return to Montreal, and I definitely recommend Bonaparte for any traveler to Montreal. You will feel as if you are in Paris without the attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location.... skip the breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: loueye
Reviews.Content: Very nice room in a great location... All of Old Montreal is within walking distance.. Parking is a $15/day at a nearby lot. Make sure they don't box your car in. Skip the breakfast if you have to pay extra for it.. It just wasn't that good, certainly not worth the menu price.

Reviews.Title: “Auberge Bonaparte Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: dsw
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! Just spent three days at this hotel and would be very happy to return. The fact alone that it is in a very beautiful part of Old Montreal, close to the Church, shops and restaurants makes it a gem. One step inside the front door of this quaint hotel and you will be delighted. Our room was a large king sized bedroom with gleaming hardwood floors and a double jacuzzi tub. Our stay included a 4 course restaurant in the lovely adjoining restaurant. My lovely, romantic and quaint! Thanks for a great stay and excellant service from the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: redhotmama43
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bonaparte twice - once with a room at the front and once with a room at the back - both were very quiet - the patio on the room at the back offered a great view of the River. The room at the front gave us a view of the street which is always entertaining. The rooms are exactly as pictured. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the beds very comfortable. The breakfasts are wonderful - no comparison to the usual 'breakfast included' buffet fare. We have eaten several times in the restaurant and have always experienced an excellent meal with excellent service. The Bonaparte is well situated in Old Montreal - close to the cruise ship terminal and the convention center. Last but not least - the best part of staying at this hotel is staff - they are 'the best'. They make sure your visit is everything you want it to be. They can make any arrangements for you and not only offer excellent suggestions on 'things to see' but give excellent directions on how to find them.

Reviews.Title: “A definite must to spoil yourself!”
Reviews.Author: Bemti
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodations right in the heart of old Montreal! Try to get a room at the back seeing as streetside can be noisy in the morning. Staff were very helpful in suggesting sights to see. Breakfast (included) in the restaurant was amazing! Try the French toast! Parking is across the street for a small fee. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Vieux Montreal”
Reviews.Author: dontcallmeillcallyou
Reviews.Content: Very good location in Old Montreal and less than a ten minute walk to the subway. A very helpful, knowlegable staff. They can guide you to anywhere you might want to go. I suggest you start with the hop-on, hop-off bus or a Gray Line 3 hour tour of the city just to get oriented. Overall service is excellent. I had no problems in the hotel. If you are a big eater the breakfast might come up a little short. It is modest in size but very tasty. You can't go wrong checking into the Bonaparte. And you might consider the Indian restaurant Gandhi for lunch or dinner. It is five minutes from the hotel and a real treat. Be careful, the portions are quite large and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely great stay”
Reviews.Author: jbigcanoe
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Auberge and the Restaurant were above and beyond. If we get back to Montreal we will stay there again. Nothing fell short during our entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable country french”
Reviews.Author: vanam1960
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from 5 days at the Auberge. It was just perfect for us. The staff was warm, helpful, informative. The rooms were comfortable and well kept; I felt I was in a large country French home (30 rooms). We stayed in 2 different rooms on the 5th floor (the highest) and had a courtyard room both times with a view of the Notre Dame Basilica (nicely lit up at night). You could also have rooms facing the street but I much preferred the ones on the courtyard. All rooms have queen beds except the suite which has a king and also a private terrace, but it is a little pricey. The first room we stayed in for 3 nights also had a terrace but it was cold and we never used it. Actually room 505 without a terrace is larger and has that same wonderful view. The terrace would probably be nice in the summer but not in October. There is also a rooftop terrace garden . . .small but nice for a drink or coffee. Breakfast is included and is wonderful . . .very filling and several choices (eggs, pancakes, french toast). We ate dinner at the Bonaparte restaurant 2 nights and were very pleased with both the quality of food and the price (under $100 for the 2 of us including wine). It seems very popular with the locals because both nights we ate there it was full. Excellent location (Old Montreal), accommodations, and food for a moderate price. With terrific service to boot, you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Would have been a 5 except for street noise”
Reviews.Author: bartschmid
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Bonaparte. The location in Old Montreal was excellent. Within walking distance of everything we wanted to do. The service was excellent - answered every question and gave perfect directions. The breakfast at the hotel was very good and the choices - omelet, eggs, french toast, french pancakes, croissants, toast....all very good. Breakfast was included in our price. The room was exceedingly clean, just the way I like it. The only drawback was the noise from the outside people until about 1:30 a.m. I thought I had requested a quiet room, but maybe I had forgotten. Anyway, if you stay here I would definitely request a quiet room. One other item was no coffee maker in the room. You had to wait until you got down to the dining room and we have been spoiled by american rooms that all have coffee makers in the room. Having said all that. We would definitely stay here again. One more thing, the bed was very comfortable. Notre Dame was just around the corner and all the restaurants that we went to (which I will review separately) were just a few blocks walk. Can't go wrong by booking this hotel. No wonder it is #1 on TA.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel with a great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: godschild333
Reviews.Content: We stay at Auberge Bonaparte for three nights and dined the night of arrival at Bonapate Restaurant. It was a very comfortable hotel in Old Montreal. The dining experience was excellent. It was so very good that we had three dinners while there. Wish it was closer to home. What a great find thanks to Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice get-away..”
Reviews.Author: advidtravler
Reviews.Content: The Bonaparte is nicely situated for easy walking. The metro is only a couple of blocks away and is a very easy means to get around. Small food store two doors down... Shopping street one block away... My room faced the "courtyard". Truthfully, I did not see much of a "courtyard". It was very quiet.. and nice to sleep in.... Only thought, breakfast stops serving at 9:30.. and I sometimes found it difficult to get up and moving by then. However, the staff was "spot on" and was there to send up coffee. My room was adequate... large for many standards... The roof-top deck that I had seen mentioned in other Trip Advisor reviews was not worth commenting.. although with very little decorating "touches" it could be quite nice. I did like that my room was made-up conveniently whenever I did decide to leave and roam the area. In many hotels if you miss the service time you do not get your room cleaned. I was in Montreal on a whim and was there for a nice long stay, so I was in no hurry to do anything but relax. This hotel is geared to personal service for sure! The staff was extremely helpful. Pleasant and more than willing to help-out with any questions, directions, fares, tariffs, etc....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Zelda21
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location in all of Old Montreal. Easy walk to anywhere is Old Montreal as well as to downtown if you are ambitious. Close to the best sites, good restaurants, fun shopping, and a little convenience store. I would choose this hotel again if returning to Vieux-Montreal. Our room was a good size (complimentary upgrade from queen to king!), was very clean and pretty well appointed. The bathroom was good size, though no real counter space so a bit of a challenge with hair dryer, make-up, etc., but only a slight inconvenience. Only other downside (which could be an upside for some people), the mattress was very soft. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Took time talking with guests. The breakfast that comes with the room was OK, nothing special, but got the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Awalsh58
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world and have to say I've received the best service ever at this gem of a hotel in Old Montreal. The young woman at the desk went put of her way to help us with anything we asked...exceeded expectations every time. Restaurant staff likewise. Situated just around the corner from the Basilica, this has to be the place to stay while vacationing here. I wish I could give it six stars. Superb!

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: valleynotebook
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, really helpful staff, great! location, quiet, spotless, charming room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Auberge Bonaparte”
Reviews.Author: oceansidetraveler0
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay. Had a great time at this hotel. Very good location, excellent service (Michael and hotel staff were exceptionally accomodating and helpful to whatever you needed). Well appointed rooms and very good breakfast. Will go back in future.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Service and Character”
Reviews.Author: marissaVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two different rooms on the 5th floor. Both had terraces and a wonderful view of the Notre Dame Basilica. We loved the character, ambience, and the great staff. They were so friendly and helpful and in a very genuine way. They seemed to truly love their jobs. The breakfasts were included and were delicious, from an a la carte menu. At any time you could have complimentary coffee, tea or hot chocolate. It is in a very quaint and convenient location, with cobbled streets outside and horse drawn caleches going by often. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel and it had excellent food and service. Although, as others have mentioned, there is no pool,, we found that in downtown hotels which are even more expensive, there also were no pools. We felt very comfotable at the Auberge, it felt like a home away from home. We would definitely return here next time we travel to Montreal. We liked the inn and the ambience much more than the downtown hotel we stayed at, which was much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Auberge Bonaparte recently for our anniversary. The staff were all polite, courteous and helpful. The room is what was expected from prior reviews, but nothing glamorous. We stayed in a Superior room facing the back. The breakfast was very good and if it's not full you may be lucky enough to get seated by one of the windows overlooking the street. If you drive, they will assist you with parking at a lot down the block, however you'll also be charged $15 a day plus tax. If you attend the lot on your own or another located just to the south of the auberge, I noticed signs for $10 and $8 a day, respectively.

Reviews.Title: “Should offer more for a US$ 200+ daily rate. Good experience though.”
Reviews.Author: TurismoRock
Reviews.Content: More an inn than a hotel, the Auberge Bonaparte could have offered more for the US$ 200+ my wife and I paid for a superior room with a queen bed. Let's go to the pros and cons: Pros: 1) Location: extremely well located in the Vieux Centre of Montreal, really close to restaurants, shops and the best tourist attractions at Montreal's historic downtown. 2) Room size: gigantic room with plenty of space to walk around, store your luggage and clothes and rest with lots of comfort. 3) Breakfast: wonderful a la carte breakfast included in the rate, with many options of pancakes, french toast, eggs, potatoes and much more to choose from. 4) Staff: very helpful and friendly staff who, being from Quebec, speak both French and English fluently. Cons: 1) No amenities: hotel lacks the amenities that make expensive hotels expensive. It offers no pool, exercise room, mini-fridge in the room etc. All in all, my experience in Auberge Bonaparte was very enjoyable and I would recommend it to others, provided they were able to secure lower rates. The hotel is clean (bathroom is really well kept and spacious; the room has hardwood floors), comfortable (nice pillows and mattress, but lacks a duvet) and near to almost all tourist attractions. The only reason I don't give it a maximum score is that I could not shake the feeling I had overpaid, since it seemed to me the hotel lacked amenities one will find in all other hotels at this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Above & Beyond!”
Reviews.Author: LBurgie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 15 nights at Auberge Bonaparte in August and we couldnâ€™t be happier with our stay! The hotel is located in Old Montreal where you can easily walk to amazing restaurants, shops, places to rent bicycles and much more. This was our first trip to Montreal. Weâ€™ve heard amazing things about the city and read wonderful reviews on Trip advisor about the hotel and everything we experienced exceeded our expectations. The hotel is very clean, quiet and inviting. While all of these things are great the best part of the hotel is the staff. Michael Bankâ€™s runs a fine place and he makes you feel like you are at home. Even before we arrived we exchanged quite a few emails with him (I always have lots of questions!) and he always responded quickly and graciously. His amazing crew (Anne Marie Massicotte, Benjamin Pelus, ChloÃ© Beaulac, & Adeline Le Cornec) were delightful and always avalable with a â€˜Happy to helpâ€™ attitude â€“ What more cold you ask for?! If you are considering a trip to Montreal look no further as this is the best place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid W
Reviews.Content: I went to Montreal with my husband for a family wedding and our stay was wonderful. The rooms are nice and bright, the windows open if you want fresh air and the room is spacious and comfortable. The hotel is well situated for enjoying old montreal as well as getting other places in montreal. Nothing is a long walk. The breakfasts at the resaurant are wonderful, not just your regular breakfast they use real maple syrup etc. While the hotel does not have many amenities; it has charm, not noisy and the staff are friendly and helpful. I nice change from chain hotels

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel? Not really as we know it....”
Reviews.Author: verychoosy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two mights in late August. Front desk staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Website pix are quite accurate - this is not a sophistaicated Hotel-du-Vin-type boutique hotel - rooms are quite basic in decor, soft furnishings and bathrooms quite tired. Comfy beds, room service (tea trays throughout the night for the jet-lagged!), and position make this worth a couple of nights. But probably overpriced for what you get. Excellent restaurant, in a higher league than the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, price, and charm - could use a touch of luxury”
Reviews.Author: GailDez
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location near the cathedral and old town. Breakfast is included and is fine. Bedroom and bath are large, but amenities are lacking. The hairdryer was old and dirty. No bathrobes. Toiletries include shampoo but no conditioner. There is really no lobby - this place is small. The desk clerks double as concierge and are very helpful. Definitely worth the price for room size, breakfast, and location, but if you are looking for pampering, this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: JimAngelo
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal, within walking distance of the Metro and several sites. The staff was friendly and always helpful. The room was clean, and we had a fine view of the street so there was lots of natural light. Overall, we had a excellent, comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “I love Old Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: carolkSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Old Montreal port section has everything, hotels, food, shopping, religious and lots of tourists! I have stayed in Montreal in the old section before and really loved it. This time I stayed at the Auberge Bonaparte, a small, fashionable hotel but without the quasi chic, trendy set, which I sometimes like to leave behind. THe hotel staff was excellent, no question too much, and this time I even got to the antique mall on the subway thanks to a clever staff member at the hotel. Went shopping where Montreal goes shopping and not the tourists. Easy to find by subway and quick. I could have stayed all day but unfortunately had to go back to work. When I went to the airport, the Bonaparte people got their driver and the car was a new Jaguar at the same price as a battered and used taxi. I really like that! Food was great, my room even though on the street side, was wonderfully calm and inviting for rest and working on my IPAD. I would stay there again in a heart beat. And did I mention this hotel is across the street from a Chuck Hughes restaurant? Impossible to get in, but because I was right next door managed easily. Just a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rugs and 100% Polyester Sheets”
Reviews.Author: ariehnimrod
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel following Tripadvisor's high rating. The property is in an excellent location and the building itself has great potential for the area (nice classic architecture and big rooms). However, the hotel is managed like a dump or for a clientele accustomed to filthy and/or smelly rugs, carpets, curtains and bed covers (the carpets and rugs haven't been washed since Napoleon's times). Beds crumble and cheap polyester linen make you fill you are sleeping in one of those hotels that charge by the house. Baseboards and walls are scratched and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel- fair price- very clean- well located”
Reviews.Author: parasols2
Reviews.Content: I originally called another hotel located in Vieux Montreal, but they were booked. I asked for a suggestion, and they referred me to Auberge Bonaparte. The rooms were very clean- no strange odors, no surprises. Beautiful hardwood floors, nicely painted walls, etc. Hallway carpets and elevator were clean. We stayed in a street side room, and I had some concern that there may be street noise- but there wasn't. It is in Old Montreal, and there really wasn't a lot of nightlife in that area. Restaurants can get pricey in Vieux Montreal, the restaurant across the street, San Mateo- a Mexican restaurant, for example, seemed pricey- 2 meals and 1 bottle of beer, ran up a $63 check with tip. I suspect that Auberge Bonaparte's restarant would be on par with that. The breakfast was good, although I think that some reviews I read here went a little overboard in their delight. If I was going to visit Montreal again, I would definitely come back to Auberge Bonaparte. The concierges were very helpful (one of them informed me that "auberge" means "inn" - you see that word quite a bit in Vieux Montreal).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but hated the Wrought Iron Bed”
Reviews.Author: 2ontheroadagainam
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor reviews were so helpful in planning our stay in Montreal and Quebec, that I wanted to share my review, as well. We loved this Auberge. It was intimate and charming and different than a traditional chain hotel. The room was extremely clean and the hotel floor was very quiet. The room was centrally air conditioned which was so necessary as we stayed here during an extreme heat wave. Our room faced the street and did not have much of a view. The two downsides..the room was a bit small with a wrought-iron headboard which was very uncomfortable, and we had to pay for parking, which is something we have never done in all of our travels throughout the U.S. However,this location is perfect if you want to stay in Old Montreal..you can walk everywhere, even if you are not that accustomed to walking. Cabs are also readily available. You can park your car right across the street from the hotel (24 hour security). We parked and did not use our car for three days. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful with suggestions for things to do, and they can arrange tours for you and even a pickup at the hotel to get to the tour. A full Breakfast is included with your room fee, and is served in the beautiful restaurant. There are many delicious choices. Tipping is suggested. We also ate dinner at the Bonaparte Restaurant which was delicious. Our one disappointment....we were never told about the Rooftop Deck. Upon arriving at home, I read some more reviews where travelers talked about having coffee and a view on the rooftop deck. We were disappointed that the staff never suggested that we go up there. We would stay here again, but only if we had a bed with a different type of headboard.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ML04
Reviews.Content: This place is behind the Notre-Dame Cathedral so it was very convenient for us. There are also several restaurants in the area since it is Old Montreal and just a couple of blocks from the waterfront. Very nice walk wherever you choose to go in the area.... I was 4 months pregnant and did not get tired. The theater next door seemed to have good plays but we didn't have time for it. The breakfast was hands down excellent!! We stayed enough days to try every option on the menu and loved it! I still remember the breads and toast.... We loved this place and will come back if we are back in Montreal on a couples' trip. Keep in mind it's not really a kid friendly hotel but great for couples or even families with grown children.

Reviews.Title: “Sagging mattress, creaking bed. Helpful, friendly, staff.”
Reviews.Author: RCP012
Reviews.Content: I have never been in such a sagging mattress - should have been replaced years ago. And the bad creaked loudly whenever we moved - a bit of an unpleasant distraction. Time to buy a new bed was probably a year or more ago. Not what one expects from a fairly expensive hotel. The hotel staff were all first rate and very helpful. The location was great, but there was no view at all from our fourth floor street-facing room (expected) and not much of a view from the roof (unexpected). Don't believe the positive remarks about seeing the gardens of the Basilica from the roof. All you can see are trees. On the whole, I was disappointed with the hotel, but the restaurant was very very good.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Place to Stay in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: EZTRIP1
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptionally nice auberge located in Old Montreal. The room was clean, large and tastefully furnished. Bathroom is a good size and has a roomy shower. The ceilings are high making the room airy and bright and a view of a large green garden lent a peaceful, almost rural feeling despite the hotelâ€™s location in bustling Montreal. There are beautiful wood floors in the room instead of the awful wall-to-wall carpeting one usually finds in hotels. We ate breakfast heartily as the menu is generous with food that features a talented chef paying attention in the kitchen. Coffee was excellent. Our one evening meal at the hotel restaurant was just fine â€“ again, the chefâ€™s work was showcased. Good, knowledgeable serving staff. There is an elevator and a rooftop viewing deck with good views. Parking is nearby with 24 hour security that is needed in a city.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints! Very enjoyable stay in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: WhitbyRovers
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Auberge Bonaparte for a 24th anniversary trip to Montreal. We chose this boutique hotel based on past Trip Advisor reviews, and must say that overall the past reviews of this hotel are pretty accurate. First of all, this was a very small and clean hotel (No Begbugs !!!). As others have noted, the rooms are quaint and a little sparse - however this and the fact that they rooms have hardwood floors did add to the overall feeling of cleanliness of the room. We also found the room (and floor) very quiet. I usually have problems sleeping in hotels and was worried when we were given the room beside the elevator. However, because there are only maybe 8 to 10 rooms per floor, we had no noise issued and slept very well! We did have a room on the 5th floor at the back of the hotel (overlooking Notre Dame), but the street in front of the hotel seemed very quiet at night, so I donâ€™t think you would have noise problems with a room at the front of this hotel either. Other thoughts: We very much enjoyed getting up and having the included breakfast that comes with room at the attached restaurant . While not huge, the breakfast is a good quality, allows different choices, and gets you going for the day. While others have noted that the cost of the room is a little pricey (which I also thought), if you remember to factor in the breakfast (~$15/person), itâ€™s actually not too bad of value. We always seemed to be out and about and never ended up eating dinner at the restaurant, so canâ€™t comment on the restaurant quality (too many great outdoor cafÃ©s/restaurants in the area to enjoy!!) The hotel is also perfectly situated for walking! Itâ€™s obviously great for visiting Old Montreal, but it was also only a 15 minute walk up to Rue St. Catherine for the obligatory shopping trip! The front desk was also very helpful/friendly and helped us order tickets to see a comedian at the Just for Laughs festival (again, only about a 15 minute walk uptown). Negatives: None really! Parking is not at the hotel, but at a small outside lot about 100m up the street. Parking is $15 per day, which I think is fairly reasonable for any city lot. Arriving is a little confusing given the traffic flow and narrowness of the streets. Advice (watched others doing this while enjoying breakfast at a window seat at the restaurant): the street in front is one-way and the hotel has an allowed standing time for unloading â€“ when arriving (if there are spots) stop on the LEFT hand side of the street in front of the hotel and put your flashers on. You can then unload, check-in and get your parking tag that you need for the lot up the street. Only other funny thing we noted was that the rooms do not have movies you can rent. After a long day of walking around, we thought weâ€™d settle back with a bottle of wine and see what new release movies were available for rent â€“ however they only have cable and no Pay per View in the rooms. Certainly not a deal breaker, but a little odd. Overall â€“ Is this really the best hotel in Montreal? Canâ€™t really comment on that as this is the first and only place weâ€™ve stayed at in Montreal, so we have nothing else here to compare it to. However, we very much enjoyed our stay, and would not hesitate to stay here again if the opportunity presented itself and would certainly not hesitate to recommend the Auberge Bonaparte to others who are looking for a place to stay in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: enewellz
Reviews.Content: My wife & I decided to stay a few nights in Old Montreal and found the Auberge Bonaparte here on Tripadvisor. This place exceeded our expectations in many ways. I was apprehensive about parking, but they have a place to pull up & unload, then you park in a guarded lot up the block. There is a charge, but it is super convenient. The staff was very friendly, especially the concierges we encountered during our stay. They helped us get Grey Line tour tickets, gave good advice for shopping & eating, and exchanged US to Canadian $ at the going rate. The room was beautiful! We stayed in a standard room towards the back of the building. Not exactly a view of Notre Dame, but not bad. Very quiet, never heard the elevator or other guests. The rooftop deck is small but neatly kept, great place to chat with fellow guests. The Auberge is located just a minutes walk from Rue St. Paul, which is where we spent most of our time. You are a short walk from more restaurants, shops, museums and galleries than you will be able to see in a long weekend! We walked around at night & felt very comfortable in this neighborhood. The clincher for us were the breakfasts. If your idea of a great free breakfast is the all-you-can-make waffle bar at most motels, this is not the place for you! These are outstanding. Not a lot, but just enough. French toast, crepes, omelettes, with great coffee, juice, fruit, warm croissants and real butter... mmmm... where was I? Sorry... Anyway, our only regret was not eating dinner there. I know, almost criminal given the restaurant's reputation, but we were always elsewhere when dinner time rolled around. And with so many choices in Old Montreal, well, we'll just have to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Auberge has several advantages- great restaurant, parking across the street (a real advantage), helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: CarrietFranconiaNH
Reviews.Content: We selected a room on the 5th floor- at the back of the hotel- though the front would probably be fine as it is on a quiet street in the Old Quarter. We had a fabulous room with a balcony overlooking a quiet area with a sweet garden and view. I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Myles_in_Halifax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Montreal twice yearly for Board meetings and we always stay in Auberge Bonaparte. Located very conveniently in the western part of the old city, it gives easy access to downtown shopping, the Metro, and all of the vieux port. Rooms are very clean, with hardwood floors, the windows are deeply set and have charming views, and the beds are comfortable. Most rooms have a shower stall rather than a tub, but the staff are very accommodating to specific requests. The other slight drawback is that except for suites, the rooms are somewhat sparsely furnished; chairs are more upright than cushy. Staff are excellent. Invariably pleasant, helpful, appropriately attentive, respectful. We have never had a complaint about any of the service and have always been well treated. A plus is the presence of one of the city's best restaurants in the hotel. Don't miss the French Toast for breakfast; and breakfast is included in the room price, which is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Suite 507 is AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: SherryBarringtonNH
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one suite that this hotel offers. It was larger than our first apartment! One bedroom separate from the living room has a king size bed with two very large windows that open up to the streets of Old Montreal. The living room has a wet bar with fridge (which the mini bar was all complementary with this room), wing back chair, sofa bed. The bathroom is large with a glass stand up shower and a two person jacuzzi tub. Which is the BEST tub I have every bathed in. There is a separate shower head that comes up so that you can wash your hair in the tub, which is a plus. The jewel of the room and where we spent most of our time is on the outdoor terrace. Even on the hottest of days, there was always a breeze. There is a small table and chairs on the terrace to be able to sit and admire the view of the Basilica of Notre Dame. The only disappointment was the "view of the gardens of the Basilica". We saw a small garden which appeared to have tomato plants, but otherwise it is a parking lot and other roof tops that you are looking out on. Regardless of the view, it was refreshing to sit out there with one of the complimentary beers from the mini fridge. The central air in this room was excellent! Quiet and always cool regardless of the hot temperatures outside. Breakfast was good, certainly not the portions that we are used to, but none the less good quality, good service, and charming atmosphere. We are actually trying to reserve this room again for September.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: ford39
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in old town near restaurants, museums, the piers, and just right for walking around. The personnel were very helpful, especially the Director of Marketing, Michael. The room was spacious, the complimentary breakfast was very good, and the dinner we had there was superb. We were there for three nights and would return again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: chrisnewyork
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Bonaparte. Thanks to the front desk staff who were friendly and helpful at all times. Our room was spacious and clean and the restaurant was lovely with very good food. Montreal is a beautiful city, especially in the old port where we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy room, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: gstmichel
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. The staff was very helpful with making recommendations about places to eat. The room was a little on the small side, but very cozy. There was a lot of natural light coming through the large windows. The bed was comfortable, and everything felt clean. The location is terrific, right in the heart of the old town. We were able to walk everywhere. The breakfast was good, but not amazing. Also, I do have to say that at $520 for two nights, the hotel seemed a little pricy to me (I am no expert on the prevailing hotel rates in Montreal, and obviously we paid it, but this is not the cheapest option).

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: sueann068
Reviews.Content: We started our long holiday exploring Canada at this boutique hotel and couldn't have chosen better. Comfortable, quiet and convenient for harbour area of old Montreal. A very good restaurant but particular mention should be made of friendly, efficient and oh so helpful reception staff. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good location - but unfortunately no wow factor”
Reviews.Author: BerksTravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights whilst doing a driving tour of Eastern Canada. Very good location; close to Notre Dame and main square where there are plenty of places to eat. Room was spacious, fairly well appointed (although lacking space for toiletries in bathroom) but didn't really have any wow factor. No comfortable seating in the room and no tea/coffee making facilities - something we've come to expect as the norm these days. I've just read another review that mentioned 'free tea & coffee all day' but we were never told about this. We did look through the in-room information booklet - as we do at all hotels - but it gave very little information about the hotel (no mention of the tea & coffee, or the 6th floor terrace I now realise that they had!) but just seemed to consist of pages of menus for the restaurant! The receptionist when we checked in was very friendly, but again she never told us about the coffee or the terrace. Our room overlooked street at the front, but can't say we experienced any noise during the night. Bed was quite comfortable. Good breakfast included in the price - but it was made clear when we checked in that a tip was still expected each morning! Parking is close to hotel but beware as it is charged at $15 per day, or part thereof (not per night) - so our 2 night stay actually worked out at $45!

Reviews.Title: “Only stayed one night - wish it had been longer!”
Reviews.Author: TwoSchnoodles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for one night on July 1 (Canada Day), as it was close enough to the train station to walk, and also close enough to walk to the cruiseport. We wish we'd been there longer. The Auberge Bonaparte is a lovely little hotel in an prime location. A very decent breakfast is included at the attached restaurant; the hotel also has computers available to use at no cost. We checked in quite late on July 1 and were upgraded as we were the last room to check in that night. The front desk clerk was friendly and efficient and also told us there would be fireworks on the river, just 10 minutes away by walking. The fireworks were great; our room faced the street so there was some street noise into the early hours, but I expect that was because of the crowds returning from the fireworks and would not normally be an issue. As we were checking out the clerk asked if we'd made it up to their roof top patio. We had not, and were glad she recommended it, as the patio offered impressive views of Notre Dame, Vieux Montreal, and the river. As I said, we were there only one night, but would have liked to stay longer. We would definitely choose this hotel in the future if we return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay - get a garden view room”
Reviews.Author: jvachon
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to all we expected, which may be partly due to the fact that we were given a garden view room. Opening up the windows each morning and enjoying the breeze was very pleasant. The staff were very helpful and the location was incredible - part of the Notre Dame grounds. If you stay here take advantage of the 6th floor terrace. It's a good way to end the afternoon and map out your next day with a drink. All in all, we have travelled a lot and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect boutique stay”
Reviews.Author: skmmdpc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 3 days at the Auberge Boneparte in Montreal for our 35th Anniversary. It was PERFECT in every way. The staff couldnt have been more helpful (Thanks Michael!!); the location was ideal- the restaurant a destination in and of itself, and the rooms perfectly apointed. The value was great. We can't wait to return.Magnifique !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bwdlinks
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights here and it was great. The staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful especially the girls at the front desk. They always greeted us cheerfully, suggested restaurants to try, sights to see and made bookings for us. The waiters were professional and attentive as well. The Bonaparte is perfectly situated on the edge of the Old Town and within 3 blocks of lots of restaurants, shops and cafes. There is wi-fi as well as a lobby computer for guest's use. The rooms are a nice size, clean and comfortable. We had a 5th floor room overlooking the street and never were bothered by street noise. Breakfast, included in the cost, had lots of choices and was served in a beautiful dining room that is a busy, well reviewed restaurant at night. There is free coffee and tea all day including to your room. This is an excellent boutique hotel that is well run and a value for the $179 per night we paid. AAA discount. Book as soon as you can as it is very popular and fills up early. We enjoyed dinner at Barroco, two blocks away and the view and drinks at the rooftop outdoor patio bar atop the Nelligan Hotel, 3 blocks away. Other meals were at various restaurants in the Old Town and were uniformly good. Like everywhere else these days Canada seemed expensive to us Americans, about a 25% premium, and especially the 17% tax on EVERYTHING!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Quiet Close to Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: appywanderers
Reviews.Content: Booked room facing street Rue Francoise Xavier as better price. On 5th floor serviced by elevator. Good choice hot beakfast included. Nice small roof sun deck to enjoy a BYO beverage. No mini fridge but ice machine 6th floor. In old town 5 minute walk to Notre Dame Basilica, 15-17 min to China Town or Jacque Cartier Place. Excellent restaurant @ $$$ prices, 3 course $30, 5 - $ 55, 6 course degustation $ 66 sublime!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best place to stay in Montreal!!”
Reviews.Author: rajpriya99
Reviews.Content: We chose Auberge Bonaparte based on the raving reviews on Trip Advisor. We stayed with family for 5 nights while on vacation, and it was possibly the best place we have ever stayed in all our travels so far! The staff were very friendly, helpful and always available. Adeline especially and the hotel supervisor, Anne-Marie were both very sweet. The rooms were nice, comfortable and quiet. The best part was its great location in Old Montreal. Easy access to everything. As mentioned in previous reviews, the breakfast is superb and included in the price! My kids loved the breakfast. They have never really enjoyed the breakfast in the other places that we have stayed in the past. We left the hotel at 5 am this morning to catch our early morning flight. Rimad, who was the night staff was so nice to prepare breakfast for all of us at 4.30 am!!!!! We were so impressed by the service, that I decided to write this review promptly on our return today. We would definitely stay at Auberge Bonaparte, and I recommend this place very highly. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “An awesome hotel - stay there!”
Reviews.Author: frequentflier20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Auberge Bonaparte with my 10 year old son. It was his first trip to Montreal, and the first time I've stayed at a "boutique" hotel in this city. We found the Auberge Bonaparte to be centrally located, with very good service and good value. We recommend the restaurant highly for food quality and friendly service. We would easily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice.”
Reviews.Author: pateve97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auberge Bonaparte for 5 nights during the first week of June. Our room was comfortable and very quiet. The hotel staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious--probably the best breakfast we have ever had at a B and B. The restaurant is high quality (though a bit pricey). The location was perfect for touring purposes. And the computer was consistently available so we could check email. We give Auberge Bonaparte our highest rating and we would definitely return. Pat and Steve Weiner

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: sxeight
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a cruise. We checked in early; so the room wasn't quite ready for us. Went out to lunch and our bags were already in our room. Excellent restaurant recommendations. In the heart of Old Montreal. Our room had a a great terrace with nice views of Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “The Gem of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: HMG44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a prize find. It is historic, quaint, clean and friendly. I booked the reservation direct with the hotel by phone to find out more details. Adeline was sweet (Sweet Adeline) from the time I booked the reservation, to the time we checked in and throughout our 4 day stay. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The room was immaculate and overlooked Rue Saint Francois Xavier to the sound of horse drawn carriages. Only one block from the main art and restaurant district and 4 blocks to the convention center made this the perfect, yet secluded location. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was superbe and included with the room. This is a definite the next time we come to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Place in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vasio
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Some of the staff reminded of us Disney villains (mean for no reason, and quite animated). But, overall our stay was fantastic. The nearby parking lot made for quick and easy trips to neighborhoods all over the city. There are parking meters in every neighborhood you could ever want to see. The old port area is very charming and feels European. The nearby Keg restaurant was awesome and has a great selection of local beer on tap. The shopping is great. Montreal is now one of our favorite cities, and we will most likely come back and stay at this hotel again. One other downside, the room's AC was weak. But, again, this hotel has charm, nearby parking, a great breakfast, and easy walk to everything the Old Port has to offer. Montreal is a 10! This hotel is too.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kebabster2011
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located very close to Notre Dame. The breakfast was delicious and the rooms spacious and very clean. The staff were also extremely helpful and friendly. There was a lovely little bar area with a fireplace where you could have a drink and warm up. we were upgraded to a room with a spa bath for three of the four nights, so that was a great suprise.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful (yet small) gem found in the city...and no pun intended!”
Reviews.Author: magelbagel23
Reviews.Content: The Bonaparte was rated #2 on Tripadvisor at the time my husband and I were searching for a hotel in Montreal, Canada. We always research on our own, rely on reviews, photos and location but were definitely intrigued by the high rating. The hotel was exactly what we were expecting; quaint, old-fashioned looking but all up to date and impeccably clean, perfect location (in Old-Montreal) and the most tasteful decor and furnishings in the rooms with two huge windows providing so much natural light. The staff was nothing but helpful, no matter what we needed or what questions we had. The restaurant which we only visited for breakfast was great, although quite limited in choices (for breakfast). The negative point is that we quickly out-grew the space as there wasn't even a dresser in the room to unpack our stuff. Not only was there no dresser, but there was no actual spot other than the floor, to put the suitcases. The closet only had 5 hangers and even in the bathroom, there was a small glass shelf about 6 inches wide above the toilet, again, no space for our toiletries. We actually put the "do not disturb" sign up towards the end of the the 5 day trip because we were embarrassed to think house-keeping would take us for slobs! Our stuff was everywhere, over the back of the chairs, piled in the window sills, there was just no room! I highly recommend requesting a larger room as I am sure there were other options, we paid $145 per evening in their off-season for a king room and thought we would definitely have more space for the price. Other than that, we loved it and would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “This was a perfect experience.”
Reviews.Author: DebbieJean33388
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous stay at Auberge Bonaparte. Despite the rainy and cold weather, we had a perfect stay. Our room was spacious, clean, quiet (we asked for a courtyard room) and not the cookie-cutter type that we are used to. The king size bed was very comfortable. The daily full French breakfast, which was included in the price of the room, was delicious and really got our day off to a good start. We enjoyed eating at a large window and were able to look out onto the quaint cobblestone street. The concierge staff went out of their way to make sure that all our needs were met and our questions were answered. They arranged for a Greyline tour the morning after our arrival, and set up 3-day Metro passes (at $16 a day, it's a steal.) They also exchanged money for us. When we checked out there were no surprises. The location was also ideal. We were within a few minutes walk to a Metro station, Notre Dame Basilica, and fine dining and live music in Old Montreal. The next time we go will be in summer when the weather is supposed to be perfect, and we will stay here again. The people of Montreal are not as genteel as those in France, but they are genuinely friendlier. Whenever we got lost, we did not hesitate to ask a passerby or store clerk who politely helped us out. Montreal's primary source of income is tourism, so they have a reason to be helpful and polite. I speak French and my husband does not, but it made no difference. The average person speaks both languages equally. They are not snooty like the people of Quebec City who will not talk to you unless you speak French.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: jdunne1983
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located centrally in Old Montreal. It is clean and fresh although it could use some touch-up paint here and there. The staff is fantastic; we relied on them for all our suggestions for dining and their reconmendations were spot on. We would definitely stay there again. Word to the wise, road noise can be a problem and we could hear our upstairs neigbor dragging a chair in the middle of the night, so look for a room on the top floor and on the back of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest and most friendly place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: kleebeck
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Montreal for a hockey game. We chose the Auberge Bonapart because of all the positive reviews we read. We were certainly not disappointed. The front desk peson was so welcoming and she had lots of suggestions for us. Our room was the cleanest room we have ever stayed at....ever. It looked like we were the first people to stay in it even thought the hotel has been in existence for 11 years. The breakfast (included in the cost of the room) was wonderful and a great start to the day. The Mexican restaurant across the street is very good with great margaritas. We would never stay any place else in Montreal. Hopefully we will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: FluffynMan
Reviews.Content: We had one night booked and ended up staying for 3 nights because we loved this hotel so much. The suites were absolutely sweet. Superbly clean with seemingly brand new furniture and bedding, The staff was wonderful and of course the breakfast was fantastic, We plan on returning long before summer gets here, Wonderful Hotel and highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Manolo15591
Reviews.Content: The Bonaparte experience is a cozy and friendly one. We stayed for five days and found this auberge to be everything positive other reviewers have said about it. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The free wifi comes in handy if you've traveled from abroad and have no roaming on your phone. The signal is pretty strong and the connection fast anywhere in the hotel. The hotel has almost no ammenities but if is an auberge, after all. So if you're looking for a spa or a pool, you need to go elsewhere. On the other hand, the location couldn't be better: within walking distance of lots of places to eat and see. The only observation we have to make is that our bed was a little noisy but I'm sure they were probably ready to replace it ahead of the spring season.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for in a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: mann_marsha
Reviews.Content: Auberge Bonaparte has it all. A chilly day and you are greeted with gracious hosts and offer of coffee. Rooms are immaculate, peaceful and with lovely views. Breakfast is included with stay and the service and food compliment the hotel. Exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: jbafa02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a great quiet street in old Montreal. It's walking distance to the metro, right around the corner from the Notre Dame Church and next to one of Montreal's main Theatre's. The hotel has a great restaurant and breakfast was included with the room rate. The breakfast was very good. You have the same limited choices everyday but they're all good. We had a street side room and did not have any problems with noise. If you live in a major city you'll be surprised how quiet Montreal is, even though there's about 4 million on the island. The front desk was helpful with all our request, i.e. restaurant reccommendaions, taxi's etc.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable and accomodations and service”
Reviews.Author: BabyFactory
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Montreal for the first time for a four-day shopping get-away with a girlfriend. After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor we decided to give Auberge Bonaparte a try and we were not disappointed. The location of the hotel is excellent and in the heart of the Vieux-Port. There were galleries, one-of-a-kind shops, and restaurants and bars all around. There is also a small theatre next door to the hotel which we were going to investigate but ran out of time (next visit!) It is within walking distance of the Metro which quickly whisked us to and from Rue St. Catherine for shopping. The hotel itself is very charming and we found all of the staff to be helpful, professional and very tolerant of our French! I have to say that the hotel staff in particular and Montreal service staff in general took their jobs very seriously whether they were a bar waitress or store clerk - it was very refreshing not to get re-buffed for asking a question. Our room was immaculate with hardwood floors, a double and queen bed and a lovely view of Notre-Dame from the window. Neither of us had any problems sleeping on the mattresses and the beds were comfy - although the room was a bit chilly and there was only one extra blanket which we took turns using. Yes, we could have asked for another one but we were so busy and it was not a big deal. The bathroom had a separate shower and a large soaker tub and there was another sink outside of the bathroom itself which made getting ready much easier. The included breakfast was very nice although we found the choices a bit on the heavy side. If you are into big breakfasts you will be very happy, it was just not how we are used to eating every day and some lighter menu choices would have been great. Having said that we were never unhappy with the quality or taste of breakfast. We had not planned on eating at the hotel restaurant for dinner but ended having to do so one evening because we returned so late. We inquired on our way up to our room if there was anything available for dinner and they very graciously accommodated us even though it was busy. (We did notice that the taxi drivers did not seem to know where the Auberge was but knew the restaurant, always a good sign- by the end of trip we would say we were going to the restaurant and it saved a lot of confusion.) Dinner was very nice and we had the sole which was done to perfection. Again, a little bit heavy, even for fish, but I also attribute that to being on vacation in general and only being able to take so much rich food. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again and am hoping to return with my husband as I think it is a great little romantic hotel. Compare the price with other hotels in Montreal and you will find this one is a bargain, except you get a charming, clean room and great service and a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & Elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: seraphic
Reviews.Content: Auberge Bonaparte is a lovely quaint hotel in the heart of old montreal. Room 501 has a wonderful terrace overlooking the courtyard of the Notre Dame Basilica. We viewed the beautiful new year's fireworks right from our terrace windows! The breakfast which is included, is served in the elegant Bonaparte restaurant, and is plentiful and well prepared. The free internet service was also very helpful. Overall our stay was very pleasant, relaxing, and comfortable. My only concern was the bed, which was too soft for both of us. Other than that we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE HOSPITALITY!!!”
Reviews.Author: senshisky
Reviews.Content: We researched this hotel for a two night stay in the city. We just showed up and Michael quickly found us a beautiful room with an unbeatable rate. It is walking distance from everything and located in Old Montreal. The service was excellent. The restaurant is cozy and known throughout for its great breakfast.The waiters were so cute.. Especially the one who was a Patriots fan. I highly recommend this place and will stay here for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Believe everything you have read about the Auberge Bonaparte on Tripadvisor -- one lovely experience!”
Reviews.Author: hardtoplease75
Reviews.Content: We received an upgrade upon checking in -- a lovely, quiet room, very comfortable bed and bathroom. The staff could not have been more helpful and pleasant. Having such a wonderful restaurant is a real big plus after a long day of sightseeing, and the breakfasts were outstanding. Will not consider staying anywhere else should we return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Small but charming, friendly, helpful. Make you feel welcomed”
Reviews.Author: PEIsland-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Montreal for a conference but also made it a little get away with my spouse. Rates at the conference hotel were outrageous so began looking for options in the area. Narrowed it down to 3 spots, all rated highly on Trip Advisor, although none were without some detractors.In the end we settled on the Auberge Bonaparte. We stayed in a standard room, street side despite some comments about possible noise. I called to book the room and enquire about a CAA discount; was offered $10/night off the rate . Check in went smoothly. We arrived early so our room was not ready but promised it would be done up next. Breakfast was still on so were offered a continental breakfast on the house. We then went for a walk and upon returning an hour later, we were warmly greeted and our luggage all ready waiting for us in our room. The room was quaint, smallish but not squeezed in. Well kept, clean. Not lavish but nicely furnished. No closet but a nice multi purpose wardrobe served well. Windows actually opened. Bed was comfortable. We were on the 3rd floor. Could hear voices from the street, not a disturbance that kept us awake or needed the TV up louder. If there was a large or rowdy group on the street it may have been an issue but not something we experienced in our 3 nights. A small mini fridge/ bar fridge tucked into the wardrobe or nightside table would have been ideal - not having one was my only complaint. Free internet access a plus and breakfast each morning in the restaurant (included in price) was filling and delicious. We had dinner in the restaurant (Bonaparte) the first night. We enjoyed it so much we decided to make reservations for the other 2 nights of our stay as well (I recommend you try it at least once). The staff in both the hotel and restaurant were friendly, helpful, very welcoming. Michael at the front desk was super.
