Was there from early AM to well into the evening each night of our stay but he did ensure us he had a couple days off coming up that he was going to enjoy. We will certainly stay at the Auberge Bonaparte again and suggest you give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JohninEngland
Reviews.Content: I hardly need to say anything as it's all there in previous reviews. The location is perfect for seeing Old Montreal, and the nearby metro station is your gateway to the rest of the city. The staff are friendly and helpful. We had a room away from the street so no noise issues; it had a wooden floor and a comfortable four-poster bed (without the canopy). The TV was hidden away inside an armoire, although we didn't need it. The ensuite bathroom had a proper (although small) bath as well as a shower. Up on the top floor, next to a conference meeting room, there is an ice-dispensing machine, just right to go with the complimentary two bottles of water and petit-fours. Breakfast is included in the price, served efficiently by the staff and with plenty of choice of hot and cold items. Near reception there is a computer with free internet access. Dinner in the restaurant is excellent, with a range of set menus, a large a la carte selection and an extensive wine list. There are also plenty of good restaurants in the vicinity. If we return to Montreal, we would definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Rhubie
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in we knew this was a very special place. The staff was welcoming, warm and helpful. The Breakfasts were elegantly prepared and delicious! Dinner at the Restaurant was beautifully prepared and the memories of our meal will last for a very long time. Our room overlooked the gardens of the Basilica, was well appointed, extremely quiet and very spacious . We will definately return and highly recommend the Auberge Bonaparte!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful location, large quiet room with old wooden floors”
Reviews.Author: rigoletto57
Reviews.Content: the manager, Martin is excellent, his English is flawless. Knows the city and is adept at helping his clients. One of the assistants is Mino and he was wonderful. The room is beautiful, lovely linens, the breakfast is beautifully presented, the restaurant for dinner is excellent as well. The location in the old part of Montreal partakes of a segment of Paris of long ago and I enjoyed that very much--away from the commercial and business part of Montreal was delightful. will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for exploring the old town”
Reviews.Author: Malsorman
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay as everyone was very pleasant and made us feel welcome. The service in the dining room is excellent with breakfast being an absolute joy as we were given so much choice. Although our room was tastily furnished and very comfortable, it was rather noisy due to the passing traffic, so we would have preferred a room at the back of the hotel. There is a great choice in restaurants within five muntes walking distance. We recommend the little corner cafe; Olive & Gourmando in 351 Rue St-Paul Ouest which serves delicious snacks, cakes and coffee etc - not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: waypicky
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to stay. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The rooms are clean and spacious, the beds comfortable. It was a delightful surprise. It almost seemed as if we were in Europe. The hotel stay included a fully cooked breakfast, which gave you a choice of several items. The location of the hotel in Old Town Montreal was right in the middle of everything. We were able to walk to the harbor, the Cathedral of Notre Dame, and through Old Town. It was a great location--and that's what they say, location is everything.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spot”
Reviews.Author: Travellers5710
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go to Montreal, whether for business or pleasure, this is where we stay. It is quiet and the staff are very friendly and helpful. It is close to the Palais de Congress and to all the sights of old Montreal. To go further afield it is close to the Metro. It is not an uncomfortable walk to 'down town'. The included breakfast is one of the best anywhere. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Style Hotel with Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: angeleyes27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple weeks ago. I had one of the more elaborate rooms. There was a really nice jacuzzi tub with jets and a separate shower. The beds were very comfortable. The hotel was around the corner from the Basilica Notre Dame and about 4 blocks from Jacques Cartier Square. Parking was down the street and you had to leave your keys with the car so I would not leave valuables in the car. You had to pay $15 for the day to park. Breakfast was included in the morning and had very good croissonts. Staff was very helpful and bilingual.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Old Montreal experience”
Reviews.Author: LPK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over Canadian Thanksgiving weekend. Chose this hotel for a romantic weekend away based on all the glowing reviews on his site. The hotel did not disappoint! We were in a courtyard room which was extremely quiet and spotless. The housekeeping staff were extremely thorough and cleaned the room beautifully every day. The room itself is nice but not anything extraordinary. Some spots are starting to look a little worn with chipping paint and cracked tiles, but nothing serious. Loved the hardwood floors! Service was superb with lots of friendly helpful suggestions and assistance. Breakfast every morning was lovely and tasty, albeit a bit slow on two of the four mornings. Location is perfect for exploring the city, with only a five min walk to the metro. Overall extremely happy with our stay here and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Emptynesters80
Reviews.Content: Located in a wonderful area of Montreal's "Old City." The service was top notch from the desk staff to the waiters at the restaurant. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant and were very impressed with the superb food and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy hotel in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: springbokny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Auberge Bonaparte for a weekend anniversary trip to Montreal and very much enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a great location in the old town part of Montreal with easy access to downtown shopping and the Metro. The staff at Auberge Bonaparte were very friendly and helpful with any and all of our needs and made our stay very pleasant. The room we stayed in faced the street and while not anything to write home about with regards to amenities, was still spotlessly clean with a TV, good size bathroom and very comfortable bed that had extra pillows. The restaurant in the Bonaparte is very well regarded and served up a very good breakfast with superb, friendly service. If I had to complain about anything, it would have to be the late night noise from the street. Not really Bonaparte's fault, but with a street facing room, Friday and Saturday nights can be noisy on the street with late night carousers and the older style windows not providing much sound insulation. Not a big deal for us as we've had the same experience in London Hotels, but one might try a garden facing room if noise is a big concern. All in all we had a wonderful stay at the Bonaparte and if we returned to Montreal would certainly stay here again. A charming choice in the old city of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay, staff fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Janis_1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fantastic way to end our holiday, all the staff at the Bonaparte were very helpful and went out of their way to make you feel welcome. The room was very comfortable and spacious and tastefully decorated. We also highly recommend the restaurant, which has a lovely choice of dishes, served in a relaxing environment.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and very convenient to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Tr6zo
Reviews.Content: Very nice, close to everything and very romantic. Excellent restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME ROOM, AWESOME VIEW. AMAZING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: TLaw28
Reviews.Content: A good friend, and colleague (Bill I owe you huge) suggested I go to this hotel. The cobble stone roads outside of the quaint entrance should have told me I would be in for a treat. The service was amazing, the food was exquisite and the hardwood floors gave it a very warm feeling. The bathroom are also very stunning and spacious...it made me wish I had come with my significant other. All stars in my opinion. T.O Law

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: NYCRuth
Reviews.Content: I picked the Auberge Bonaparte based on trip advisor recommendation, and we were not disappointed. It was everything the reviews had promised. The location is perfect; the rooms are lovely , the beds are very comfortable and those big windows open to views - it does feel a little like Paris. The air conditioning was a pleasure to come home to since it was so very hot the week we were there. Breakfast was delicious- I could not stay away from the crepes. The only mistake we made was not having dinner there - considered one of the best in town. We did eat very well - newer place called Restaurant DNA in Old Montreal and an even better , very local "neighborhood" spot up near McGill University- La Montee du Lait. Both were excellent You will not be disappointed staying at the Auberge Bonaparte. The staff was wonderful - great on directions and had great recommendations for wine bars

Reviews.Title: “A real jewel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernBurt
Reviews.Content: Was there for three nights before a cruise. Location is great. Charming area wonderful for walking and biking. Plenty of interesting ethnic restaurants nearby as well as variety of shops. Hotel is big enough to provide great service yet small enough to make you feel welcome. Concierge is terrific. I've dined all over the world and the hotel restaurant can compare with the best. The free breakfasts in the restaurant were full service, first class. Rooms were spacious, comfortably furnished, excellent air conditioning and windows that opened. A bit of noise from the street but very quiet after 11:00PM. Finally, I already booked reservations for next year. I'm proud to sign my review... Burt Katz

Reviews.Title: “Charming Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Janebharris
Reviews.Content: Auberge Bonaparte is a charming "boutique" hotel in the heart of Old Montreal. It is small, (30 rooms) quaint and attractively furnished. Although not particularly luxurious, it is comfortable and represents a refreshing departure from the ubiquitous, hotel -chain "formula" hotels. My husband and I celebrated our 40th anniversary over Labor Day weekend, 2010. Taking a cab from the airport we arrived at the hotel during the mid-afternoon. Our room was ready and check-in was friendly and efficient. Earlier during the week my husband had called to ask the hotel to arrange for a floral piece to be delivered to the room before our arrival. The lovely bouquet was there as requested, and the staff quickly supplied a large vase to accommodate the flowers. Other services, such as reservations, etc. were handled just as efficiently. Our room was somewhat small by US standards, but was certainly adequate for the two of us. Furnishings consisted of a king-sized bed, night table, desk, side table and chair, along with an armoire which housed the tv and two drawers. Hardwood floors and crown moldings added to the charm of the room, which was decorated in creamy gold and red furnishings. Floor lengths draperies framed casement windows with deep window sills, opening to the street below. The bed was comfortable and furnished with feather pillows (important to us, as we dislike foam pillows.) Drinking glasses were made of glass rather than plastic and two complimentary bottles of water were provided. The bathroom appeared to be newly renovated with attractive ceramic tiled walls and floor surrounding a large, whirlpool tub. The pedestal sink was small and there was no counter space. Two small glass shelves accommodated toothbrushes and other toiletries. Everything was very clean. There was a small, elegant restaurant attached to the hotel. We ate dinner there one night, during which the food and service were superb. Our table was on a small balcony overlooking the street below. The atmosphere of Old Montreal is quite charming and we were treated to a vista of hanging baskets of flowers festooning the buildings and horse-drawn carriages traversing the narrow streets. The hotel is located ideally for exploration of the Old Montreal area -- everything is within walking distance. Perhaps the most famous landmark in the area is the Basilica of Notre Dame, located on the next block. Shopping and restaurants are also conveniently located. Breakfast is included in the price of the room (which for us, was about $200. US) This was a far cry from the "continental" breakfast bars often found in the United States. We were able to order delicious breakfasts comprised of juice, coffee and fruit accompanying menu choices of eggs, omelettes, crepes, etc. All food was made to order and served by the professional waitstaff. In all, we found the hotel to be a delightful venue, to which we hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Auberge Bonaparte was the perfect little...”
Reviews.Author: StellaSue
Reviews.Content: Auberge Bonaparte was the perfect little place for a 4 night stay in Montreal. The location was unbeatable-- right in the heart of the Old City, steps away from restaurants and galleries, and a 5 minute walk to the Metro. Our room was one of the most comfortable we've stayed in. Not only was it incredibly clean, but the exposed brick walls, wood floors , and tall windows with lots of light made us feel like we were in Paris. The breakfasts each morning were fabulous, and the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff made our stay very enjoyable. Overall, a 5 star stay at a price and location that can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “So impressed!”
Reviews.Author: juliecz
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this wonderful hotel. I've stayed multiple times, and I would recommend it to anyone. The location is terrific, the staff is very friendly and helpful, the breakfast is great, and the rooms are charming. In addition, I left my iPod behind (oops) and when I called to see if it had been turned in, I was soooooo impressed to find out that not only had it been turned in but it was already being sent to me. That's awesome!

Reviews.Title: “What a welcome retreat in a busy city! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Charmagne88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August. It is a wonderful small hotel with wonderful staff, convenient parking, and a nice breakfast included with the price of the room. We loved the area of old Montreal and this inn was well located and easy to get to. The room had a queen and a double bed and slept the 4 of us nicely. The bathroom was fabulous with a great whirlpool tub, and 2 sinks. My kids liked that there was a tv with a lot of different channels. Very beautiful hotel with updated rooms and AC a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! All Around nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Gramps31561
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and enjoyed the hotel very much. Convenient to everything. Good full breakfast. Appreciated the public computer. Very helpful staff. Nice clean room.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel and a fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kebutler1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited to celebrate our 20th anniversary and spent 4 nights. This hotel was an excellent choice. Our room was quite beautiful and very clean. The bathroom was well appointed and maintained. Ann Marie at the front desk was charming and helpful, encouraging us to use our high school french. The breakfast each morning was lovely. You have a choice of hot entrees including french toast, crepes and omlettes. These were served with croissant, muffins and a beautiful fruit salad. We would definitely return. Our room faced the street and on Thursday there was some noise. Most nights were quiet. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury in the heart of Vieux (Old) Montreal”
Reviews.Author: conalvo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Auberge Bonaparte, a medium-sized, updated hotel in Vieux (Old) Montreal. We were greeted warmly and found that we had been upgraded to a king room with a jacuzzi tub; we had originally booked a standard queen room. The room was spacious and clean with views of the street. The decor was classy and understated, real word furniture and hardwood floors, which suited us just fine, and I loved the space in the modern bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the air conditioning worked very well despite the unusual heat wave. The Auberge Bonaparte is very close to the cathedral Notre Dame and near to all the action of Old Montreal. It has a roof deck which guests can use to enjoy the sights, with a fantastic view of Notre Dame. The Bonaparte has a restaurant which served a delicious, substantial, cooked-to-order breakfast each morning (included with the price of each night's stay). Although we didn't have dinner or lunch in the restaurant, the selections looked quite good, and I would consider having dinner there in the future. Parking is available for a fee, and it is in a lot across the street from the hotel and the Centaur Theatre nearby. I highly recommend this option, as street parking is nearly impossible to find, and the narrow streets of Old Montreal are difficult to navigate. Park the car, use it only when necessary, and take advantage of Montreal's metro system. The Place D'Armes station is just a couple of blocks away. The hotel was quiet, the rooms clean and spacious, the location was convenient, and the service was impeccable. I have paid far more for far less in other locations, and I'm happy to report that the Bonaparte went beyond my expectations. The Auberge Bonaparte, though not a "budget hotel," was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: happiness4all
Reviews.Content: We arrived during a heavy rainstorm. Although there were two people working in the lobby neither of them seemed interested in even holding the door open, much less helping with the bags. The woman at the desk never made eye contact while going through the check in procedure. It was as if she had something else on her mind and was uttering her memorized script in a robotic way. Fortunately, when we entered our room we were very pleased with its size, decor, bathroom, and bed comfort. The location is minutes from all the places you want to go when vacationing in Old Montreal. We had a room on the courtyard side which was lovely. The roof terrace is a great place to see a view of the city. The breakfast is yummy, but the service is spotty and they make very sure that you are aware that "although the breakfast is included in the room-the service is not." We did not eat dinner in the restaurant, but Narcisse down the street has excellent house wines by the glass and a gorgeous bar where you can listen to jazz. I found this hotel to be a value and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Torrance_Trojan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a four night stay in Montreal at the Auberge Bonaparte. The staff was very pleasant and accommodating. The breakfast that was included was very tasty. We had the French toast, French pancakes, and omelettes during our stay. We also had dinner there which was also excellent. We had to leave very early one day for a tour to Quebec City and they provided us with coffee and fruit well before the restaurant was open. The hotel is located a block away from Rue St. Paul which has many shops and good places to eat. We also highly recommend the Steak Frites restaurant on Rue St. Paul. Order the escargot with cheese as an appetizer, the best we've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: murphygirl2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June for 2 nights and was impressed from the moment I arrived. The staff is wonderful - very friendly and helpful. I was traveling alone and had never been to Montreal before, but the staff immediately put me at ease and made me feel at home. The room was cozy and so delightful - very roomy with beautiful windows set in wide alcoves where you can sit and sip coffee and pour over maps of the city to start your day. Breakfast in the restaurant was excellent - the waiters are friendly and attentive, and the french toast is out of this world! The location was perfect - the Basilica is just around the corner and all of the museums, cafes and shopping in Old Montreal are within easy walking distance. I highly recommend this hotel - all of the positive comments from other reviewers are spot on. I would love to stay here again - hopefully in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Heart of Old Town”
Reviews.Author: travelokpa
Reviews.Content: When we booked hotel we could only get 2 of the 3 nights we wanted. 5 days before we left for our trip we were contacted by the hotel and we received the third night. Great follow up. The hotel parking lot was 1/2 block away so we had access to our car at all times. Reasonable fee for parking. The room was on the second floor facing a couryard witha huge (at least 8 feet by 5 feet) double window. The view included the rear balconies of other houses with there flowers in a distance with excellent privacy. We had a queen bed but the room was large enough for a King bed with a lot of room to walk around. The bath was in another room with a hallway enterance. We liked the wood floors and filickering wall lights as optional lighting. Breakfast is included in one of the best restaurants in Old Montreal. We usually ate in a table for two that was on a street side window. The food was excellent and relaxing. The Hotel was on a main street, central to Old Montreal one block fron the Bascilica Notre Dame. Good Location good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davepelpt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights to attend a convention(Palais des Congres is only 3 min walk away) and were completely charmed. We had requested one of the rooms with a balcony but the balcony was actually a large patio overlooking the gardens behind Notre Dame and the rooftops of Old Montreal. Bedroom itself is not large but the bath is complete with whirlpool tub. We sat out on the patio most of the time we were in the hotel. Staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. Restaurant was the best of those we tried with the most professional staff. We hope to go back. and will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Evanstonians
Reviews.Content: I came for a conference in the university of Montreal and stayed in this hotel for two days. The rooms are very nice (and much more special than the standard business hotel). The staff is very friendly and the Restaurant attached to the hotel (which is also serves the complementary breakfast) is excellent although a bit expensive. The location is amazing right in the middle of the old town within walking distance of downtown as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, concierge staff and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: shadowpriest
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Montreal during the Easter weekend and was lucky enough to book two rooms for the four of us the day before arrival. Pros: - the best thing about this hotel is the location, right next to Notre Dame and within 5 mins walk to the port area of Old Montreal - concierge staff extremely helpful - esp the girl who spoke great english as she was born in mississauga - room is impeccably clean - room rate includes 3-course breakfast at the hotel's restaurant - not to be missed ( i particularly liked the french toast!). Be prepared to deal with rude waiters though. Cons: - church bells in the morning. It wasn't too bothersome but might be a problem for light sleepers who want to sleep in. - furnishings lacked personality, especially the old fashion drapes and bed coverings - minor problem for us as long as everything was clean - we had dinner at the restaurant one night and although the food was delicious, the waiters' service was horrible. I agree with other reviewers - they definitely have an attitude problem. Don't bother getting the upgraded room with glass showers, the standard room facing the street is roomy enough. For the location and breakfast, $140 we paid per night was reasonable. Old montreal was definitely the best location in Montreal, especially for couples as it was very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: mckayshields
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at Auberge Bonaparte. What a wonderful experience! We arrived to find out they had given us an upgrade as an anniversary gift. We had a lovely room on the top floor with a view of the Basilica. The best part was opening up the windows to let in the breeze and listen to the bells chiming. The room was spacious and nicely appointed. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. I usually wake up a lot when we stay in hotels and I slept through the night each of the 3 nights we were there. Also, the free wifi was a big bonus! One thing we discovered a little late was the rooftop terrace. If you go up to the 6th floor, there is a door to the outside and there is a lovely little terrace with seating and amazing views. The hotel was so incredibly quiet. I would never have guessed we were in the middle of a city when the windows were closed! The breakfasts every morning were really yummy. If I had one suggestion, it would be to offer a bit more variety in that department. By the 3rd morning, we were a little tired of the choices, but they were very good. You can't beat the location! We easily walked all over Vieux-Montreal and it was so charming with the narrow cobblestone streets. We also walked to downtown from the auberge and it was an easy walk. I highly recommend Auberge Bonaparte and we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A PLACE..LOCATION IS PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Josphina
Reviews.Content: Auberge Bonaparte is perfect.. very large rooms.. huge bathrooms..price is good for a big city..full breakfast .French delight and at the right location around the corner from Notre Dame, water way, musemns and two wonderful restaurants at the corner plus the one in the hotel. This 31 room delight is located a half a block from the American threatre in Montreal... we saw the most wonderful play.. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: sarahtatum
Reviews.Content: A wonderful boutique hotel, friendly staff, excellent! And the small amenities were great, the front desk staff prepared breakfast for our departure (at 4:30 am), calls to the US were free, the small courtesies like this go a long way....

Reviews.Title: “A bit of Paris within reach”
Reviews.Author: purpelph
Reviews.Content: After the Parisian plans were negated by the Icelandic volcano, I made plans to drive to Montreal and Quebec City. I booked one day and drove the next. And fortunately found Auberge Bonaparte. The inn is in a beautiful section of Old Montreal, nestled up to the back of the Basilica. It is removed from the tourist traps farther to the east and steps from great restaurants, boutiques and art galleries. There is an English speaking theater next door with outstanding productions. We were upgraded to a beautiful room with two beds and high ceilings, tasteful furnishings and a view of the yard behind the Basilica. Although the room was well removed from the street, it was a bit noisy when the guests above us decided to move furniture at midnight over the wooden floor. There was a power problem one evening when we returned from the theater. We were given complimentary wine in the restaurant next door and then escorted with lots of candles to our room when it got late. This is an adventure rather than an inconvenience. The service was always excellent and gracious. Their English was always better than my French. A full gourmet breakfast was included in the price at the Bonaparte Restaurant next door. Excellent and elegant. We dined there one night and it was outstanding. Not inexpensive but definitely worth the price. Parking was expensive but that was expected in an old area. It worked very smoothly with unlimited in and out privileges. We walked everywhere. The port area is fascinating. Cirque de Soleil and the Science Museum were within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Auberge Bonaparte Montreal tres tres bien”
Reviews.Author: fritkis
Reviews.Content: I chose Montreal for my sisters and I for a pre birthday celebration. Going off-season to Montreal meant bleak weather and bars, restaurants, and sites were quiet. But the hotel turned out to be a good choice for us. The rooms were huge and nicely furnished. We had two rooms with a view toward the cathedral. And the staff was very helpful. The best thing was the restaurant! The food, the food, oh my god the food. Everything we tried was delicious. Venison Terrine, Chicken Liver Pate, Soups & Salads, Chicken with Morrels, Dover Sole Meunier, Tuna, the lime chiffon pie, the sorbet, the bread, the wine --- all great and the service was very gracious. My only criticism is I wish the bar was more bar like and active and that businesses in the area were not closed on Sunday and Monday as many were. I would definitely recommend the hotel especially spring, summer, and fall. Enjoy! (If anyone buys that $5,500 bottle of wine, let me know how it was.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, professional staff...overall a very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: USAFReb
Reviews.Content: I found this place on line and made reservations to take my wife here while I was still in Iraq. I had zero trouble with the reservation or transaction. Upon arrival, the staff was efficient and friendly, and the room was great...extremely clean and very quiet. The bells from Notre Dame could be heard very softly in the background. This hotel is very centrally located to anything you'd want to see in Old Montreal. The restaurant serves breakfast, which is included in the price, and the hours are very accommodating for those wanting to sleep in a bit. The breakfast itself was very good...I recommend the French toast. There are also multiple restaurants and cafes within short walking distance, not to mention museums and shopping. When we checked out, the staff stored our luggage and arranged a cab for us so we could take one last sightseeing walk. Overall this was a great deal and we recommend anyone visiting the area take a hard look at the Bonaparte.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews Don't Lie!”
Reviews.Author: LacEdge
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing the amazing reviews and the price. I checked multiple websites before booking because I couldn't believe that a hotel rated this good could be so affordable! THE REVIEWS ARE TRUE! After reading the reviews, my expectations were high. The service and accomodations we received FAR EXCEEDED my high expections. Upon check-in, the hotel automatically upgraded us FOR FREE to a courtside room. We didn't even ask- they just did it because they knew they had a better room that was going to go unused. Once we got to the room, I was blown away. It was spotless with wood floors and two large windows facing the courtyard and Notre Dame. The location in Vieux Montreal couldn't be more perfect too! The room was quiet and the church bells could be heard gently in the back ground around 9am but it wasn't disturbing at all. We ate dinner in the restaurant and it was amazing. It was overpriced but is worth the splurge for one night. The FREE made to order breakfast was the BEST I've ever had. It comes with Tea or Coffee, assorted breads, yogurt or fruit salad, and YOUR CHOICE of a hot plate (ex: crepes, french toast, omelette...). Two words: SIMPLY AMAZING! In short, I would stay here again in a heart beat and I would recommend it to everyone who came within an arms length whether they asked for my opinion or not.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKim59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auberge Bonaparte for 2 nights. I have never had more thorough and efficient service. The desk clerk mapped out our travels for us, told us how to take public transit, even sold us the bus tickets. I left my phone charger in the room when we checked out. I didn't bother to call them, just gave it up for lost. It showed up in the mail about a month after we got home! What a great surprise. Great location and lovely rooms, great breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrseiselburger
Reviews.Content: The Bonaparte was fabulous, from the accommodating staff to the charming room--lots of space, beautiful maple floors, cozy and comfortable decor, clean and modern bathroom. A room complete with all the practical necessities a traveler needs--hooks for bath towels, a light in the closet that pops on when you open the door, two windows with curtains that can be drawn for privacy, and window wells roomy enough for a suitcase. And yes, the breakfast was as good as the other reviewers' raves. In all, it's an oasis of calm and comfort in a bustling city. We moved here from the Hilton Bonavenure, which fumbled our reservation. How lucky we were!

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTABLE, GRACIOUS AND UNPRETENSIOUS”
Reviews.Author: robertj7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent three nights at Auberge Bonaparte. The room was clean and comfortable with a lovely view of the adjacent church's backyard. The hotel is centrally located in the midst of wonderful restaurants, not the least of which is the hotel's restaurant. The french toast, which is part of the complimentary breakfast, is the best I've had, and the service is impecable. We were sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jhasko
Reviews.Content: After an enjoyable 3.5 hour ride up the Northway, we arrived in Montreal and the side street that is Saint Francois Xavier. A young man quickly assisted with our bags and directed me to the parking lot 100 yards up the street. After a warm greeting from the front desk, we were directed to our room which was ready despite our early arrival. It was a delight as was every part of our stay. Immaculate in every detail, and properly decorated in a Napoleon theme with period-style furnishings and pine hardwood floors, the room as with all the hotel far exceeded our expectations. A huge spotless bathroom with a great shower and windows that opened into a courtyard just added to abience. The hotel is around the corner from Notre Dame and in the middle of Old Town, yet just two blocks from a very efficient metro. The breakfast that is included in the price is served in a perfect dining area complete with linen table cloths, sterling silverware, excellent service and high quality food. The french toast was fantastic. On one evening we enjoyed the $28 pre-fix diner which was excellent for the price. The local trout was especially enjoyable. It is just a great place to stay with high cleanliness standards and a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “I stay here over and over”
Reviews.Author: Todieinparis
Reviews.Content: I am originally from Montreal so I am familiar with the terrain, hotels and restaurants etc. Bonaparte is a wonderful place to stay. Even the least expensive room is spacious with a nicely appointed bathroom. Rooms on the street can be a little noisy but since the hotel is not on a main street it isn't too bad. Back rooms face the big cathedral so be ready for bells! Its not a bother at all actually. The rooms combine modern amenities with old world charm - the hotel is in two old buildings that have been completely renovated. The service is exceptional and the staff is friendly. In summer - high tourist season, park the car in one of the nearby lots and don't move it till you leave - the small streets of Old Montreal get very crowded and it is difficult to get around. Take a cab or better yet - walk! The restaurant is top notch with the price to go with it. We had a birthday dinner where two of us splurged and spent about $300 CDN (inlcuded a bottle of wine and a half bottle of Veuve Clicquot). But the food was very good. A nice treat! The rooms are a very good deal on their own. Dress up for dinner - breakfast is included and you can dress down. A couple of good sushi places nearby, and plenty of French restaurants too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelhk
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay (especially for couples). Notre Dame is around the corner and loads of restaurants nearby. Breakfast, which was very good, was included in the room rate. Definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was very friendly”
Reviews.Author: ptbarnaby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to old Montreal to celebrate our 5th anniv. The staff was great and helped make this a very special weekend for us. They got us an opener and wine glasses so we could enjoy a drink on our terrace. They even suggested a new wine bar around the corner on Notre Dame that was fantastic. I don't think we've ever stayed anywhere where the service was as nice as here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Geoff & Barbara
Reviews.Content: We received a friendly welcome and overall good service : there when we needed it, otherwise present but not pushy. The room didn't have a very inspiring view but was large, quiet (always a real bonus!), fresh-looking and clean with modern polished wood flooring. There was plenty of hanging space, although not really enough hangers. Shelf and drawer space was adequate.The bathroom was a good size with a double jacuzzi bath and a separate shower cubicle. There were two sinks - one in the bathroom and one just outside, which seemed strange at first, but actually turned out to be quite useful. Breakfast was excellent, with a good range to make your choice from. The price is included in the room charge, but would have been $12 each if we had been "en passant".

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VenturaTraveler13
Reviews.Content: A small botique hotel about two blocks from the waterfront. Newly refurbished and absolutely spotless. We had a room next to the elevator, which usually portends trouble, but we never heard a thing. No room to room noise either. Room was large, with a view of a church's garden. Very good bed, new hardwood floors. The rate is most reasonable as it includes a made-to-order breakfast in the restaurant and in-room high speed wireless. We ate dinner in the restaurant and give it high marks, too. Casual atmosphere, very good service, no rush and good food. This property is a genuine find. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “way overrated”
Reviews.Author: Boston023
Reviews.Content: sure it has all the amenities you'd expect, but the place has absolutely no character. in the future, I'd rather pay more for a place with fewer little perks that actually makes me feel like I'm in Montreal. oh, and the waiters in the restaurant have a terrible attitude.

Reviews.Title: “a nice little getaway”
Reviews.Author: delphi11
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Auberge Bonaparte. The room itself was lovely - the hardwood floors, exposed brick wall, and bathroom were all very "old world". The bed was comfortable, and the room was quiet at night for sleeping. The only negative was that if you wanted to read or watch TV at all, it was uncomfortable to do so while on the bed, with its curved iron headboard. However, this is a small complaint - if you are in old Montreal, you will hardly be spending much time in your room. The hotel was perfectly situated for sight seeing. The dinner we had in the hotel restaurant was very well prepared, and the service was good. Our only complaint was our waiter at breakfast the following morning was obsessed with his tip. When he seated us, he mentioned that breakfast was included in the room rate, but please could we note that the service was not included. He made himself very scarce during our breakfast, and it was only when we were about to depart that he rushed over, scanned the table for his tip, and seeing nothing, asked, quite anxiously if we were going to be including it with our room charge. This is something that we are always very conscious of when dining out on a plan where meals are included, and of course we had been prepared to tip generously when we arrived for our breakfast. The fact that the only real interactions we had with our waiter concerned the money we would be leaving left a bit of a bad taste in our mouths, and unfortunately overshadowed what would otherwise have been a really lovely and romantic getaway. I would not let that deter me from recommending it, but it is something that the hotel might wish to deal with in their service training.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sarandipities
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay in Montreal as we were sitting in the airport about to fly there, and found Auberge Bonaparte on the Lonely Planet website and booked it. When we arrived in Montreal, we took public transport to Old Montreal (a little long, but worth it!) and walked to this little inn right in the heart of old Montreal. Staff were welcoming and helpful and we went up to our room, and it was beautiful! We loved the accommodations, and were so happy with the hotel and their service. Great little romantic room. Hotel is in a fantastic location. The breakfast was pretty tasty, and we were all alone in the restaurant. Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great for convention travel”
Reviews.Author: Summitpark
Reviews.Content: Several weeks ago, I traveled with a group to Montreal for a tradeshow. I couldn't have been happier with the Auberge Bonaparte for the following reasons: 1) location, location, location. The hotel was just 2 short blocks from the convention center, and was also in the heart of Old Montreal with its cafes and interesting boutiques. Every night, our group would take a short walk to find a cute little bistro for dinner. 2) Made to order breakfasts were great. I think that this was the best french toast that I had ever had and the coffee was wonderful as well. 3) Free wireless internet. 4) Large rooms with hardwood floors. 5) Bathroom had a huge whirlpool tub with very nice ammenities. The only thing I found lacking in the ammenity department that they did not offer hair conditioner. 6) Staff was very friendly. I had several boxes shipped to the hotel and the staff was very gracious and accomodating. Note, that the Hotel Auberge is not a 5 star hotel, but it was clean, quiet and convenient. If you are looking for the high energy of a large metropolitan hotel, this may not be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: oreham5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before leaving on a cruise. The location was perfect!! We walked to the port in the morning. The hotel itself was fabulous. The room was clean and nice. You could look down at the city from the window. It is just around the corner from Notre Dame. The food in the restaurant downstairs is good, but a little pricey. Fortunately, the breakfast is included in the room price. The people at the desk were beyond amazing. They were extremely helpful and friendly. I would not hesitate to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “a fine establishment”
Reviews.Author: Shi Hu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a well run establishment in an excellent location. Our spacious room #401, facing a rear grove of trees, had a large bathroom and was immaculately clean and quiet; in fact, it seemed sound proof. The staff was courteous and helpful and a gentleman who identified himself as the owner was frequently onsite. The restaurant had a lovely ambience and the gracious staff seemed to be headed by the efficient and ebullient Martin, who took a personal interest in "fitting us in" one busy evening when conferences and theater seems to make reservations a problem, even for hotel clients . A note of caution - Don't take for granted last minute dinner reservations just because you're staying at the hotel! I agree with other comments on this fine hotel. A comfortable reading chair would have been welcomed. Also, small rugs or mats on the wooden floor on the side of the beds would be nice, as well as a coffee (tea) maker in the rooms or in the lobby. The breakfast selection could be enhanced by other than egg selections for those whose mind their cholesterol. And, having a computer printer available should be a consideration of the management.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: akinken
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Stayed in the one room that has a terrace. Absolutely great. Sit out there with a bottle of wine or beer and enjoy the sights and the weather. There is a suite that has a terrace, and then there is a terroace on top of the hotel. The people who work in the hotel are fabulous and very outgoing and will do their best to make your visit enjoyable. Seeing as the hotel is in Old Town, very quick walk to see the sights. And the Metro is just a few blocks away. If we were going back to Montreal, this is where we would stay. There is a fabulous restaurant on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love Bonaparte- highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: namastenatalie
Reviews.Content: We stayed last weekend in the Auberge Bonaparte and we really loved it. I cannot say enough good things about it. The room was beautiful and the location could not be better. We had a king size bed, hardwood floors & our window looked out onto the cobblestone street where we could watch people walking by & hear the clip clop of the horse drawn carriages. Very romantic! We had breakfast there every morning (included in the rate) and the restaurant is lovely, the staff very friendly & cordial and the food is very good. A nice selection and very enjoyable. The front desk staff is fantastic. They were so incredibly helpful with giving us inside tips about the city (it was our first time there) and made reservations for us. The woman at the front desk (Chloe) was so incredibly helpful and really really friendly. She spent quite a bit of time showing us different parts of the city on a map & telling us the best places to get there. She also knows a lot about Montreal and the different night spots & was able to recommend restaurants and bars for us. We love her! We truly enjoyed it so much we have already booked a weekend to go back in December. The price was very reasonable, parking is done conveniently right across the street. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Charming Location”
Reviews.Author: lynnzie513
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auberge for four nights. It is located in the Old City, which is charming and just the neighborhood for those who love French ambience. The neighborhood is full of restaurants, boutiques, galleries and shops, perfect for exploring on foot. Our lovely, spacious room overlooked the gardens in back of the property. Even though the room was above the excellent restaurant in the hotel (Bonaparte), there was no noise. The decor was understated but elegant. The large marble bath more than met our expectations. The amenity package is first rate. The staff was friendly and helpful, giving us excellent recommendations for lunches, dinners and shopping. A delicious breakfast is included in the room rate; don't miss it. Speaking of food, The Bonaparte restaurant serves outstanding French cuisine. There is a three-course table d'hote menu, a five-course tasting menu or ordering a la carte. Be sure to make reservations since the restaurant is always busy. For those who are traveling by car, the Auberge has arrangements with a parking lot across the street. You can take the car out whenever you like without any additional charges. I would happily stay at the Auberge Bonaparte again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: randbcraib
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights in the Bonaparte at the start of July and were very happy with the experience. As a location for a first visit to Montreal we felt it an ideal choice. It was very easy to access all of Old Montreal as well as only a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station ( Place d'Armes ) to be able to explore downtown Montreal and beyond. There were many restaurants and cafes in the area which were good. We enjoyed a meal at Boris bistro as well as one in the Bonaparte itself - not cheap but very delicious with professional service. The hotel itself had eveything we required, was very clean, well air conditioned, a comfortable bed, totally quiet ( we were at the back) with a very pleasant and helpful staff.We particularly enjoyed the served breakfast which was of good quality and not too heavy.At a reasonable price for Old Montreal, I think this hotel would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place to stay, but missing some amenities”
Reviews.Author: ladybug4028
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely, clean room at this hotel, and the price was right for Old Montreal, which can be pricey. In the hotel was a beautiful French restaurant, and free breakfast was served each morning (waiter service, not a buffet). Sorry to say the room did not have a coffee maker, so if you woke up before the restaurant opened you would have to leave the hotel to get coffee (also no refrigerator). Also, our room had two arm chairs and no sofa, making watching TV less than comfy. The downstairs bar had a computer but no printer, so we could not print our boarding passes and the hotel said they had a policy against doing this for their guests. This is all probably typical for a B&B, so if you are expecting lots of amenities in Old Montreal you are probably better off at the Marriott. However, we still enjoyed our stay. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was very large, with a shower and a jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: BoomerFoodie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located within easy walking distance of all major Old Montreal attractions. Easy parking across street. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were exceptionally clean, quiet, and roomy. Breakfast included at connected restaurant. Food (had two breakfasts and one dinner there) was simply delightful. We are "foodies" and know the difference. Quality was superb; prices were reasonable; wait staff knowledgeable and professional. Would go back in a heartbeat. You can't go wrong at the Bonaparte!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: SBrantley
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking of staying here be sure to ask for a room away from the street. The noise is absolutely staggering; it will keep you awake until 1 or 2 a.m. Our room was a large corner room; it was o.k. but not as great as the reviews made this place out to be. We just felt there was no ambiance; the room had hard wood floors which resonated with every sound and very tinny furniture. The bathroom was large but could have used an area to leave items such as a toothbrush and makeup. Location was good and food in the restaurant was okay -- not great -- but okay. The service in the restaurant, however, was great. Very friendly and accommodating people. All in all, the next time we're in Montreal we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: rayjay80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auberge Bonaparte for one night before our cruise ship departure. Everything was great. We had a room on the 5th floor facing the street. But heard nothing from traffic or people below or from the adjoining rooms. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in the center of the old town section of Montreal so there were numerous cafes and shops nearby. But we decided to dine in the hotel's restaurant. The meal there was fantastic. A little expensive but the food and service were definitely worth it. The hotel was close enough to the cruise ship dock that we walked with our luggage there instead of having to take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: edesem123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in June and just loved it! The location is great, right in the centre of old montreal, and close to some really great restaurants (Casa Mateo - mexican, Stash Cafe - polish, and of course, Bonapartes). We ate at Bonapartes one evening, and it was excellent - amazing food, and great service, and although it is expensive, it is very good value. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were beautiful, very clean, and surprisingly very quiet, and although there are no coffee or tea facilities in the room, the hotel staff delivered coffee to the room when we called down for it in the morning. All in all a great visit to Montreal, and a great stay at Bonapartes!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: 2pards
Reviews.Content: There is nothing negative I can write, only many positives - very clean, excellent location in Old Montreal, very friendly and helpful staff, wonderful breakfast. We had the room with a balcony which was an added bonus. The only thing I regret is not eating in the hotel restaurant (which I am sure would have been as good as the auberge) If you are looking for a small quality hotel in Montreal, this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel, Amazing Staff, Great Room, Will Go Back Soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: 280studios
Reviews.Content: First time traveling to Montreal, and we did it in Feb. never again, way to cold. We arrived really early at the Hotel Bonaparte, our room was not ready, but the front desk guy was nice enough to put us in a better room so we could sleep for a bit and then get breakfast. The breakfast here is great, it's not a cheesy buffet or anything. It's a simple, clean, sit down breakfast where you can choose from a few items. I loved the breakfast, it was great, we looked forward to it every morning! The room we had was clean, bright and very well kept. I couldn't find one thing i disliked about this hotel or my stay here. The staff was super friendly and helpfull, giving us insights on what to do, where to go, and how to make best of our short time in the city. If you stay at this hotel make sure to meet Mr. Micheal Banks, the director of marketing, he's great and can definatly let you know whats good in the city. thanks hotel bonaparte we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Freq_Bus_Traveler
Reviews.Content: In the times that I have visited Montreal, the times I've stayed at the Auberge Bonaparte have been the absolute best. It is located near the Palais des Congres and in the heart of Vieux Montreal. Its costs are quite reasonable compared to the large chain hotels, and it is by far the best hotel that I or my colleagues have enjoyed. Breakfast is included, and is fabulous. The rooms are a taste of Europe, and are scrupulously clean! The staff is nice and very helpful. This is a superb place to stay - I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Generally what we expected”
Reviews.Author: pernicketytraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night for our 20th anniversary. There were no surprises based on all the feedback on this site. Our room was on the third floor with a view of the courtyard. I asked for this in hopes of a quiet room based on others comments, and it was. The room was very clean, with a nice and spacious bathroom. The rooms are rather simple not luxurious by any means. We had dinner on the premises, the food is good but not great. The service felt inconsistent and at times we were forgotten. My salmon came undercooked and when I asked to have it cooked more, it seemed to take far too long, at which point my husband was done his entree. Breakfast is included in the room rate, and was good. We would stay there again, but try some where else for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in beautiful Vieux Port, but a little loud on weekend nights”
Reviews.Author: superd00per
Reviews.Content: Montreal is a great city and this is a really great hotel in the "Old Port". The hotel was really nice and the breakfast (included with the cost of the room) was soooo amazingly good! Have the french toast! In fact, the breakfast and the location of the hotel were my favorite parts. It's a 3 course breakfast consisting of fruit or yogurt first, then toast or croissant and finally your breakfast entree. As I already said, the french toast is the best I've ever had (and I'm not a french toast fan). The old port is NOT in the center of the city, but it's just a short walk and metro ride away. The streets, churches and cobble stone streets of the old port were so beautiful and we loved going for walks every day even though we'd seen everything a ton of times. The hotel was clean and the staff were very helpful and polite. I personally found the female staffers much warmer and the male staffer a bit cold, but still very polite. The only thing that wasn't too great about this hotel was that there are a few popular bars next to the hotel (double edged sword!) and on weekend nights (Friday/Saturday) it can get pretty loud. Approximately from 11 to 3am you will hear very loud bar patrons walking the streets. One night I was continuously awakened by what sounded like a metal dumpster being pushed (without wheels) down the street, making this awful high pitched screeching. This noise was bad, but not the fault of the hotel. *Restaurant suggestion - Holder, a steak house. Try the butterscotch dessert!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: We own a B&B in the states and one of our guests this summer gave Auberge Bonaparte a glowing referall and Two Thumbs Up. Having just returned form a 4 day stay in Montreal we are echoing those praises! Ideal location, cheeful and knowledgeable staff, spacious/clean room, terrific breakfast and even more fabulous dinner! Five Star Experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: beepbop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bonaparte in October and found the overall service excellent. The breakfast is amazing but we found the restaurant food to be average and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Old City Boutique”
Reviews.Author: joedat
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Montreal was strictly for pleasure, sightseeing and the enjoying the best restaurants. We wanted a hotel that was in or close to the Old City. After extensive on-line research (the reviews in Tripadvisor Frommers and Foder's Montreal Travel Guide) I chose Auberge Bonaparte. The hotel in around the corner from Notre Dame Cathederal and within in walking distance to the entire Old City sights, restaurants and shops. Our room had a view of the the top of the Catherderal. There's nothing much to the lobby, but don't be fooled. Our rooms were clean, beautiful hardwood floors and extremely comfortable beds. The hotel is wifi. Whether you stay at the Bonaparte or not, make sure you make a dinner reservation if you enjoy eating. A bit pricy bit we went through appetizers to deserts with several bottle of wine. The staff and waiters were all terrific. Other restaurants I recommend for lunch Mondavie, Le Bourlingueur, and AIX for dinner, all within walking distance. The Metro is about 2 long blocks dwn and over. Take it and the bus to Mont Real for a spectacular view of the city. No need for a car. We took Amtrack's Adirondack train through New York. What a way to travel to see Fall Foliage.

Reviews.Title: “great choice. will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: booking6
Reviews.Content: I also agree with all the positive reviews. Rooms are very nice. Our bathroom had a large jacuzzi tub with a separate shower plus two sink areas. Lots of space in the room. Attractive hardwood floors. Breakfast was amazing...just like many others have written already. We ate dinner there on Saturday night and found it to be excellent food and service. Pricing was very appropriate. With soups, wine, two entrees, and one dessert our bill came to $120. I like the old town area for strolling and interesting shops, bars, etc. Then the new area is only a short walk away. I recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: vickiandrich
Reviews.Content: Our 5th floor room was lovely! Not a very interesting view (out onto the street) but the room itself was large, very bright and clean. The hotels location is fabulous, right in the middle of everything in the old town. The highlight for us was the breakfast, included in the price and cooked fresh with a choice of eggs, crepes (the hotel has a very french feel), toast etc etc. Its served in the restaurant, which is very simiiar to a French cafe, very appealing and a lovely way to start the day. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: KBSilverSpring
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Auberge Bonaparte in mid August 2007. It is a charming, comfortable, and quiet hotel in Old Town Montreal. I would strongly recommend it to anyone traveling to Old Town Montreal. Around the corner from the Basilica Notre Dame, and the main tourist streets in Old Town it has an ideal location without the crowds. Our 2nd Floor room faced the street but was very quiet, and we appreciated the AC during a heat wave. The bed was comfortable, the bath well appointed. The wood floors and furnishings were charming without being "hospitality". The staff was fabulous, they took excellent care of us. Storing our luggage at check in and check out, delivering it to our room, searching on the internet for obscure jazz clubs and bands, they were very helpful on every point. Breakfast was delicious and not heavy, the crepes in particular were delicious. Service in the restaurant was top notch. We even made use of the tiny little bar behind the front desk. They have a roof top deck that is sadly under developed - mostly a hide out for the smokers. The Bonaparte was a peaceful refuge from the tourists and heat . We would happily go back and happily recommend Auberge Bonaparte. One request - a robe hook in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Small but excellent”
Reviews.Author: MumTraveller
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed for 3 days in a large room, with 2 double beds, and large bathroom. Very quiet - room looked onto church gardens, not on the busy front street. Air Con very efficient, kept us cool, even with all 4 in the room. Breakfast was as good as the reputation makes it - really excellent, and service was friendly. Perfect location for old town Montreal, and you can walk to the subway in 5 minutes, and get anywhere in the city from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, close to all”
Reviews.Author: scanmike
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location. Breakfast included is wonderfully delicious. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms quiet and tastefully done with antique reproductions. Highly recommend eating at the restaurant for dinner. One of the best meals we had.

Reviews.Title: “European Ambiance a step away from the tourist hordes”
Reviews.Author: DougViages
Reviews.Content: As part of a week's trip to Quebec, we spent three days at the Auberge last week. On a quieter side street, it has the flavor of a small European boutique hotel, with a 4 star restaurant to boot. The staff was helpful, the room was comfortable and spacious, with a large, tiled bathroom. The one drawback, no refrigerator. It's a minute walk from the front entrance down to Rue St. Paul, the main street of Vieux Montreal. Dinner at the restaurant was the high point of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: honeymooner0707
Reviews.Content: The Bonaparte was excellent. We stayed for a week on the street side of the hotel in the king bed room. The bathrooms were spacious and very clean, the room had plenty of space, and the noise from the street was not an issue at all (just close the window and you're fine!). The staff is extremely helpful and efficient - they will give good recommendations for dining and activities, as well as making reservations at hard-to-book spots (one of the front desk is well connected). We had a great time and would recommend this little hotel to anybody traveling here. The price is absolutely reasonable for all that you get: good hotel, good service, GREAT breakfast every morning included in the cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: GerIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem! We stayed there for a few days at the beginning of June. There was a genuine hospitality from the moment we arrived jetlagged after our long flight from Ireland. The hotel itself is very clean, comfortable and has great French charm and character. The staff were friendly and helpful in every way. Breakfast was a wonderful experience, food was delicious, and I particulary enjoyed sitting at a window seat, drinking coffee and watching the world go by. We would certainly recommend it to anyone who is planning a trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynkay
Reviews.Content: The Auberge Bonaparte is a beautiful hotel on the edge of Old Montreal. We stayed in room 216. The room was spacious, and immaculate, with a wonderful jacuzzi bathroom. The hotel web site does not lie. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant, the service was wonderful, especially Matthew, and if you walk in from the street is a bargin at 10.50 Canadian (plus tax etc). We had room service the first night we were there and had the Table D'Hote menu. It was very nicely presented, lovely food, and very good value at 60 dollars for the two of us. The staff were very helpful, reception - booking a Montreal tours for us. The day we left the Owner/Manager took the time to speak with us and asked us why we had visited Montreal and even carried our bags out. You will not be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Quaint Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: jojo
Reviews.Content: My husband took me on a surprise trip to Montreal for my birthday and we stayed at the Auberge Bonaparte which was very nice. It's in the Old Montreal section and is quite lovely. We had a deluxe king room which was spacious and nicely decorated with a fairly spacious bathroom with jacuzzi and shower which turned out to wonderful after each day full of walking. The Inn is also located right around the corner from Notre Dame. The Basilica is absolutely outstanding so don't miss a visit there. The Inn serves an individually made breakfast which was included in our room rate. It is served in the Bonaparte Restaurant which is charming and which is rated as one of the top restaurants in Old Montreal. You are given several nice choices for breakfast and we must say the french toast and their omlettes are absolutely delicious and with the other items included you certainly will not walk away hungry. We also had dinner at the restaurant and while it is not inexpensive it was delicious with nice atmosphere and attentive service - we would definitely return (the foie gras was wonderful). Our room was on the third floor and faced the front of the Inn and we had no problem with noise either from outside or any of the adjoining rooms. Everyone we encountered at the Inn and the restaurant was super nice, courteous and very helpful. All in all Montreal is definitely a place we would return to and likewise the Auberge Bonaparte. The only small things I missed were a magnifying mirror for makeup (I wear glasses), a mini fridge and a safe but it definitely would not stop me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “cute hotel but very cozy and noisy”
Reviews.Author: rkyw
Reviews.Content: Staying in Old montreal has its pros and cons. Sure you get the old cobblestone streets but you also get all the horses that cluck up and down all day long. The standard queen room was fairly cozy with a tight bathroom. Windows opened up to the street with lots of noise from the restaurant, the horses and other street dwellers. A strange occurance: we put the "do not disturb" sign up, received a phone call at 1130am to ask if we needed maid service, we had suggested 1:00p ( we were still on Pacfic standard time). They called back again at 1230p saying that the service was leaving now and if we wanted service still. We did not receive any maid service that day. All montreal hotels are fairly pricey but I guess you must pay more to get the best.

Reviews.Title: “Small with friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Istayedthere
Reviews.Content: Originally planned to stay at a Hotel in the next street, but they were full and recommended this to us, and phoned ahead to check on room status. Very friendly staff, who offered to show me the room before deciding. Beautiful and clean with a four poster bed. (Lovely wooden floor but just watch as it became very slippery when wet from snow off our shoes.) The waiter at breakfast was very friendly and keen to offer advice, and suggested that to arrive at Quebec City we should take the ferry from Levi's. By the time we were ready to check out he had asked the Receptionist to print out directions and a map to make sure we approched from the road to the south of the river. Would recommend this to someone who wanted to stay in Vieux Montreal in the heart of the shops and restaurants, and just short stroll from the beautiful Basilique Notre-Dame.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DoctorOboe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Auberge Bonaparte twice in 2006, in June with my 5 year old daughter and in October with my lady friend. I have had their smallest room and their grandest suite. The Auberge is a wonderful, elegant, clean hotel. The staff is SUPER helpful, the surrounding neighborhood atmospheric and safe. The restaurant is excellent. What's not to like? I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: leslie_and_kyle
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over the Thanksgiving Holiday. We chose this hotel as a recommendation from another hotel in the neighborhood. The location was perfect. The hotel was spotless, comfortable and the breakfast was delicious. We would definitely recommend this hotel. The affordable price is a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MNtraveler123
Reviews.Content: This is a great quaint hotel in old town Montreal. The room was very nice and clean and quite. The staff was very helpful. The best part about the hotel was the breakfast in the restaurant. Absolutely wonderful! I would definately stay here again. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely one-year anniversary, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: NBChrista
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auberge Bonaparte October 20-22 to celebrate our one year anniversary by shopping our arms off and going to a Habs game. The staff at the Bonaparte were welcoming and incredibly helpful with directions and suggestions - where to shop, where to eat, what to do, how to get anywhere. We received excellent help and service. The room was welcoming, comfortable, and nice; the bathroom was clean (++ important to me). The breakfast was fantastic. The location was incredibly handy - on a quiet, scenic little street in old Montreal. We'll be back the next time we're in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Ok not great”
Reviews.Author: Hobbes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights upon retrun to Montreal from Quebec City. This is one of those places where the room appearances are the internet are a great deal nicer than in actuality. The room was certainly clean enough but lacked character. Our room was in front and the noise ofrom the street can get pretty loud. There is a Mexican restaurant directly across from the hotel and street acoustics are such that late night revelers seem all the louder. Breakfast is ok but the eggs are so overcooked they are rendered tasteless. For the $$ we'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best in Montreal!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sparkling_Water61
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough about Auberge Bonaparte. I contacted the property direct to make reservations and Denis could not be more helpful. He made sure that we had a room with a view of Notre Dame. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. Upon our check-in Anne Marie could not have been more helpful, she even printed up names of vegetarian restaurants for us and booked reservations for us at the Bonaparte Restaurant. We dined at the Bonaparte and were seated in one of the intimate tables in the front and absolutely loved it! Marco was our waiter and went out of his way to accomodate my special needs (vegetarian). We requested champagne be sent to the rooftop terrace and they were happy to do so. The food was absolutely wonderful and my husband had the duck and could not say enough good things about it and he is a total food snob! The rooftop is pretty rustic compared to the rest of the hotel but we sat up there with a couple from Europe until 4 AM! Rafael was so nice to come up and check on us and bring us extra drinks and even umbrellas when it started sprinkling! We had such a fun time and they even brought us breakfast up to our room the next day at no additional charge. Denis is quite wonderful as he coordinated in room massages for me and my husband for our last night's stay. The staff is so helpful and I never heard "I can't do that" out of anyone. This is the place that you want to stay and owner Michael Banks will make sure that your stay is wonderful. We had the true pleasure to meet him and he already knew who we were, now that is impressive. He and the entire staff went out of their way to make our stay wonderful and I highly recommend this wonderful place when you holiday in Montreal. You absolutely will not find a better place in the city of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: TeamHQ
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a small, independent hotel in the middle of Old Montreal, this is a great choice. The location is fantastic. Step out the hotel's front door and walk everywhere. The rooms are nice -- not luxurious, but comfortable and very pleasant. Our window had a nice view of the church. Breakfast was excellent. Holy cow those croissants were good! We dined in the hotel one evening. The food is excellent, and it was generally a great experience. I thought the service was slow, but we were enjoying ourselves, and of course, dining should be done at a leisurely pace. One review we read complained that Americans were seated in the back of the hotel, as if the management were snubbing guests from the US. We imagine that they do this because they expect Americans are nervous about the language barrier, so we saw this as a way of respecting their guests. Perhaps one minor downside is that parking is in an open lot across the street; we had no problems, but if I had a luxury car I might have thought twice. Another consideration: the rooms don't have big TVs or some of the other amenities you'd get at a chain hotel, but that didn't matter to us.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: suzie763
Reviews.Content: The Auberge Bonaparte is perfect in every way. My friends and I went for a girl's shopping weekend in Montreal and wanted to stay somewhere different. We were very glad we chose this inn. It reminded me very much of Europe. The beds were quite comfortable and the the bathroom was clean. Breakfast was included and was very tasty. The service was excellent as well. It is walking distance to all the Old Port attractions and a short cab ride to shopping on St. Catherine street. We ate at Modavie which had a live jazz band - the food was superb (well worth the price!). I would recommed the Auberge Bonaparte to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Inn in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: DanioCal
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights, July 13 - 15, in the charming and wonderful Auberge Bonaparte on the west end of Old Montreal, just around the corner from the Basilica. We discovered this gem through other TripAdvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. We arrived in the city early, and were greeted by a very pleasant and helpful staff at the front desk, who helped us arrange parking and get settled in well before check-in time. We had booked the Queen size room with complete bathroom for $165 per night. The room was a bit small, but with very high ceilings which made it feel larger than it actually was. It was well-decorated (crown moldings, hard-wood floors, wrought iron bed), reflecting the Old Montreal location. Though we did not have control of the climate, our room was always comfortable during an extremely hot spell. A highlight of our stay was the full breakfast, included with the price of the room. The multi-course meal included juice, coffee/tea/cocoa, fresh fruit, croissant/bread basket, and a choice between french toast, bacon & eggs, and a couple other options. Everything was delicious (especially the french toast!), and the wait staff was so accommodating. On our last trip to Montreal, we stayed at Le Saint-Sulpice Hotel. While the room in the Auberge Bonaparte was smaller, it was just as nice, the staff was oustanding, and the price was much more reasonable. We will definitely choose the Auberge Bonaparte on our next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “The Bonaparte is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Aloharunner
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Bonaparte -- 6 women having a reunion-- we had three rooms and stayed 5 nights. We loved it. The hotel was lovely with spacious, clean, and quiet rooms and wonderful toiletries. The staff were all helpful, cheerful, and very friendly. And the breakfasts were such a highlight of the day -- lovely room, table settings, delicious food, and great welcoming service. We also had dinner one night in the restaurant and were treated to wonderful food at reasonable prices-- and a surprise sparkler on the dessert for one of the women having a birthday, This is a real gem of a small hotel. We also enjoyed sitting out on the 6th floor rooftop terrace at night and looking at the stars. It is a little rustic out there but a great view and very quiet. We had a wonderful visit to Montreal and the Bonaparte answered all our questions and met all our needs, including lending us all umbrellas one rainy night. We could not have been happier with our stay. Thank you to the Bonaparte and its wonderful staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Bonaparte Would Be Proud”
Reviews.Author: marksthespot
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed three nights and we were totally satisfied. The rooms are ultra clean and nice. As mentioned in previous posts, the breakfasts are wonderful and in a very pleasant setting. The restaurant downstairs is not to be missed. The french cuisine was excellent and the prices were very reasonable for the quality of food and top notch service. Service staff is very friendly and helpful. We would highly recommend a stay at the Auberge Bonaparte for your next stay in Montreal.
