Reviews.Title: “Made the best choice”
Reviews.Author: jel1
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the heat of July to this lovely oasis in Montreal. We arrived also to hear of the death of a family member. We live in Indiana and were far from home. After much discussion, we decided to depart early. This is when the radiator in our car blew. So, we sure had a dilema. I am an independent travel agent and seach really hard for charming, small properties. I can get a good sense on the phone when I speak with staff. I was so glad that we had chosen this hotel. It is a jewel in a quiet area of old Montreal. Spacious, Provence style rooms, very clean and peaceful. One of the best restauants in the city. Above all, the staff could not have done anything more to assist us; I felt that I was treated like an old friend rather than a total stranger. During our 2 day stay, they were just the nicest they could be. They made long distance calls, gave us a laptop to use, found radiator shops, served us drinks and coffee, and let us stay very late in our room until our car was repaired. Even the owner (Michael Banks) !!He stood on the street to hail a cab, when the one we called did not come. We even got hugs and kisses goodbye. People, this is what makes the difference when traveling. Dennis and Anne Marie were just the best; I am sure at a large hotel we would have been on our own. The restaurant staff SO great. Best Omelet I have ever had here, and I am a well travelled cook and judge of food. My only regret is that I did not get to really enjoy this wonderful place, but you should!! (ask for a terrace room, beautiful view...)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: telleaux
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay there. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms were huge and very clean. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was also very good. The location is great for taking strolls down to the old harbor and to just hang out and having a beer at one of many outdoor cafes. Old Montreal is great and has many great places to eat. Pass on Schwartz deli very over rated! Try La Fonderia it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: marben
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel about a month ago. The location is within walking distance of Old Montreal, home to the best resturants in the city as well as a great atmosphere with friendly people. At night we could just walk around the city blocks without worrying about anything but having a good time. The hotel room was very cozy. I loved the cut out windows, so you could sit on the sill and watch the horse and buggys chatter past. The rooms are a bit small, but they do not feel small since the ceiling is so high, and windows are very tall. The staff was very helpfull, giving directions to the underground, olympic park, and good resturant recommendations. Word of advice, the bio-dome zoo pretty sad with the main attraction being some penguins. Really not worth the $12 / person. The underground was just a series of connected malls, didnt feel like I was underground, just in a mall without windows. People are right about the breakfast, it was the highlight of the stay. I chose to stay here becuase I read the traveler reviews, and they did not let me down. I hope you enjoy your stay here as well as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Calgary_Traveller_8
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful find. The hotel was situated in the heart of Old Montreal. It was within walking distance to the many places we wanted to see. There were a ton of restaurant options nearby, and a small corner store just 2 blocks away. The breakfast (which was included) was amazing, made to order, and your choice of french toast, pancakes, bacon and eggs or omelette. All of the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The room was clean and well kept, although it had no air conditioning, but opening up one of the big windows in our room, cooled off the room quickly. It was a very comfortable to stay, and we would absolutely stay at this auberge when we visit Montreal again.

HotelInfo.Name: Auberge Bonaparte
HotelInfo.Address: 447 St.-Francois Xavier, Montreal, Quebec H2Y 2T1, Canada
